loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Nathan is married and has five children. He is a member of his local school’s Board of Governors. He is a farmer as well. He has been farming for fourteen years now and he is currently growing maize, beans, and vegetables. Nathan is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Nathan’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his projects. Nathan’s hope for the future is to see his family’s standards of living raised.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Rebecca is married and has six children. She is a treasurer in her local church as well as a farmer. She has been farming for twenty one years now and she is currently growing maize and vegetables, and she also keeps livestock. Rebecca is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Rebecca’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Rebecca’s hope for the future is to live a good life and see her children well educated.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya and, at over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most-elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, earning it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Cecilia is married and has two children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for five years, and currently they are growing maize, avocados and tea, and they also raise sheep and poultry. Cecilia is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide her with honey for food, and the bees will help to pollinate her crops.

This is Cecilia’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Cecilia’s hope for the future is to live a good life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials, and begin honey production.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married and has seven children. She is a housewife as well as a farmer. She has been farming for 44 years. She is currently growing maize, beans, potatoes and bananas, and she also keeps livestock. Eunice is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide her with honey for food. 

Eunice lives in Kitale, located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

This is Eunice’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her grandchildren. Her hope for the future is to live a good life in her old age.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdalene lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Magdalene is married and has seven children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for thirty years now and she is currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, and bananas, and she also keeps cattle. Magdalene is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for food.

This is Magdalene’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to start a business. Magdalene’s hope for the future is to live a life of high standards.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 52 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su hijo de 17 años. Allí tiene un pequeño taller de costura, donde fabrica ropa femenina, blusas en general y también realiza arreglo para ajustar los vestidos a la medida o hacerle mantenimiento a los antiguos vestidos de su clientela, convirtiendo su negocio en una pequeña clínica de ropa. Desde muy niña le gustó este arte, y su tía le reforzó sus habilidades pues también tenia un taller de confecciones donde ella aprendió. Rosa trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche con el fin de incrementar sus ventas y lograr cada vez un mayor bienestar para su familia. Su meta es lograr una imagen de calidad en su negocio y por esto se afana día a día. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  teles, hilos y accesorios para elaborar nuevos diseños y hacer de su credikiva una inversión que favorezca a asu negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 52, lives with her husband and 17 year-old child  in the town of Malambo, a metropolitan area in the city.  

She has a small tailoring workshop there, where she makes women’s clothing and blouses.  She also makes repairs and alterations to fit dresses or repair antique dresses of her clientele, turning her shop into a little repair clinic for clothing.  She has enjoyed this art since she was a little girl, and her aunt strengthened her abilities, because she had a sewing workshop where she learned.  

Rosa works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night, with the goal of increasing her sales and providing her family with a better live.  Her aim is to achieve an image of quality in her business, and so she makes a great effort from day to day.  

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan that she has taken out from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she will buy fabric, thread, and accessories in order to sew new designs and turn her Kiva loan into an investment that improves her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and accessories in order to sew new designs.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben es un hombre de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un bebe de 9 meses y su negocio es la realización de planos.
Él es emprendedor, inteligente, amable, sincero, responsable y trabajador. Su labor la realiza en el centro de la ciudad, en dicho lugar se encuentra un clúster de personas dedicadas al diseño e impresión de planos, tarjetas, afiches, calendarios, etc.
Ruben es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el aymara por la familia. Su trabajo consiste en la realización de planos de arquitectura para empresas constructoras, personas independientes, etc. Actualmente se encuentra en último año de la carrera de arquitectura en la universidad estatal. Su vida la comparte con su pareja y su pequeño bebe, los tres viven en la casa de sus suegro que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
Él sueña con tener su propia consultora y también le gustaría trabajar para el gobierno. Él desea realizar la compra de una máquina plotter para terminar sus estudios y también para poder independizarse y darles un mejor futuro a su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Ruben solicita un préstamo para la compra de un plotter de arquitectura para terminar sus estudios y darles un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Ruben is a 26 year old man who lives with his partner and has a nine month old baby. His business is drawing up floor plans.

He is entrepreneurial, intelligent, friendly, sincere, responsible and hard working. He works in the city center, an area in which there is a cluster of people who specialize in the design and printing of plans, cards, posters, calendars, etc.

Ruben is of medium height, with a dark complexion and short black hair. His native language is Spanish and he knows Aymara from his family. His work consists of drawing up architectural plans for construction firms, independent clients, etc. He is currently in the final year of his degree in Architecture at the state university. 

He shares his life with his partner and their little infant. The three of them live in his parent-in-laws' house which has all the basic facilities.

He dreams of having his own consulting firm, and he would also like to work for the government. He would like to buy a plotter in order to finish his studies, and also to be able to become independent and give his family a better future. It is for these reasons that Ruben is requesting a loan to buy a plotter for architecture in order to finish his studies and give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy a plotter for architects to allow him to finish his studies and give his family a better future.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is married and has nine children. She is a farmer and has been farming for 40 years. She is currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and bananas, and she also keeps livestock. Priscah is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide her with honey for medicine.

Priscah lives in Kitale, located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. At over 6,300 feet above sea level, it  is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname “the breadbasket of Kenya.” 

Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

This is Priscah’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her family’s needs. Priscah’s hope for the future is to live a good life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is close to Uganda and to Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano that straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped to preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality food sources.

Joyce is married and has seven children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for ten years, and currently they are growing maize, beans, and tea. Joyce is excited about beekeeping, because she will earn some income from the sale of honey.

This is Joyce’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to develop her homestead. Joyce’s hope for the future is to live a good life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials, and begin honey production.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed, after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest, solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Selly is married and has eight children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for thirty-three years, and currently she is growing maize and vegetables. She also keeps livestock. In addition, Selly is a member of her local Church’s choir. Selly is excited about beekeeping, as she will earn some income from the sale of honey.

This is Selly’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Selly’s hope for the future is to live a good life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials, and begin honey production.

loans.name: Michille

texts.en:
Michelle lives with her partner and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her business.

Michelle has been running her business for seven years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand it.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is a resident of Buremba, a village in Mbarara District. She has four biological children, all in school. Six years ago she started a piggery, alongside selling firewood, but it could not yield anything because of limited capital. That is when she got to know about UGAFODE Microfinance. She acquired a loan of UGX 1,000,000, which helped her piggery business grow. Because of her hard work, it continued expanding.

Now, she is requesting a loan of UGX 2,500,000. She will use the loan to buy more pigs and more firewood, to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy pigs and firewood.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is a 44-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Miguela has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Miguela has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a general store business in the Philippines for six years now.

Nemesia has requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for her general store

loans.name: Marison

texts.en:
Marison, 36, is a married woman who has six children. Three of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She sells purchase order cards, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years.

Marison requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.

In the future, Marison would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct-selling Avon products business, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years.

Marites requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more products from Avon to sell to her customers.

She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more Avon products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Unidas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIDAS POR SIEMPRE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Basilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de manta, venta de pescado, servicio de construcción.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Basilia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, quien trabajada hace varios años con este negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide independizarse.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución

En la imagen se observa una señora que esta con un niño en brazos, ella es la hermana de una de las socias que vino acompañar al grupo
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Unidas Por Siempre” (United Forever) is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Basilia is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as weaving blankets, selling fish, and providing construction services.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Basilia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her at her home. Basilia currently has a neighborhood store. She became familiar with this business after learning the trade from her mother, who was in the same line of work for several years. Eventually Basilia decided to become independent.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying provisions in bulk. She acquires her products from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and then sells them from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family. Basilia is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Basilia said that she enjoys the loans and the health services offered by the organization.

The photo includes a woman who has a child in her arms. She is the sister of the one of the members, which explains why she is pictured with the group.

loans.use: to buy provisions in bulk that she can sell.

loans.name: Merza

texts.en:
Merza is 46 years old and married. She has two children, one of them currently in school. Merza works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years, selling a variety of items such as bottled water, snack foods, biscuits, candies, and juice.

Merza has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock to sell, like bottled water, snack foods, biscuits, candies, and juice. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan, to further build her business.

In the future, Merza would like to save money to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like bottled water, snack foods, and biscuits

loans.name: Geammy Lisbeth

texts.es:
Geammy es una joven de 19 años,  vive junto a su esposo en la ciudad de  Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima cálido húmedo, un sector muy comercial ya que es la unión entre la sierra y la costa. Aun no cuentan con hijos ya que Geammy se encuentra estudiando en la universidad por las tardes.
Geammy y su esposo hace dos años emprendieron en el negocio del servicio y mantenimiento de elevadores y arreglo de chapas para los vehículos, , ellos trabajan todos los días, cuentan con un local arrendado que está bien ubicado, mientras su esposo hace los mantenimientos y arreglos ella se dedica a vender . Todo este tiempo han trabajado muy duro,  gracias a este esfuerzo Geammy puede estudiar. Geammy comenta que nunca han sacado un crédito y se sienten agradecidos con la Fundación y con Kiva por permitirles esta gran oportunidad de crecer en su negocio, con el pequeño crédito que obtuvieron podrán comprar mercadería necesaria para su taller.
texts.en:
Geammy is a 19 year old young woman who lives with her husband in the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. It's a city in the coastal region with a hot and humid climate, and is a very commercial area given that it is the union of the mountains and the coast. They don't have any children yet, as Geammy is studying at the university in the afternoons.

Two years ago, Geammy and her husband started out in the business of elevator service and maintenance and body repair for vehicles. They work every day in a leased premises in a good location. While her husband performs the maintenance and repairs, she takes care of sales. 

They have worked very hard for all of this time, and thanks to this effort, Geammy is able to study. Geammy mentions that they have never taken out a loan and they feel very grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for allowing them this great opportunity to grow their business. With the small loan that they received, they will be able to buy the merchandise necessary for their workshop.

loans.use: to buy the merchandise necessary for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic ingredients to make bread and to make modifications in his shop, seeking better income in order to have his own commercial location.

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es: A sus 54 años de edad Blanca está casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura  y a la crianza de animales, comenta Blanca  que se dedica a la ganadería desde que era una niña ya que sus padres también se dedican a esta actividad, le va  bien en el negocio de criar vacas  aunque tiene que pagar de la hierba, Blanca va a invertir el crédito en la compra de una vaca para mejorar su negocio y por medio de este seguir ayudando a la educación de sus 2 nietos que pasan la mayor parte del tiempo con ella.
texts.en:
Blanca is 54 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband works in agriculture and also raises animals. Blanca says that she has been raising cattle ever since she was girl because her parents were in that line of work. She is doing well at her business of raising cows even though she has to pay for the fodder.

Blanca wants to invest her loan in the purchase of a cow so that she can improve her business. This will also enable her to continue helping her two grandchildren with their education since they spend most of their time with her.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 35 años de edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y decidida para poder superar en la vida, ella no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino ella alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, ella tiene cuatro hijo el primero ya tiene familia separada y los últimos tres son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad  y se ha convertido en el motivo para que Manuela se levante todos los días para trabajar y solo así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 	
Ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de maxan en la comunidad donde ella vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace diez años, ella realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que ella dará al crédito es para la compra de terreno para poder cultivar mas maxan en su comunidad, ya que para ella es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de maxan produzcan hojas de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de ella es la siembra de más plantas de maxan y ver crecer a su hijo en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Manuela is 35 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman and determined to better herself in life. She does not let herself be defeated by the obstacles that life presents to her, but she reaches all her goals and dreams. She has four children. The oldest already has his own family, and the last three are students in the school in the community and have become the motive for which Manuela gets up every day to work. Only in this way can she have an economic income to improve the living conditions of her family.

She obtains her economic income through the production of maxan leaves [used for wrapping tamales] in the community where she lives. Her parents taught her this work ten years ago. She sells her products in the market and in the surroundings of her community, and thus she has an economic income for improving the living conditions of her family.

She will use the loan to buy land in order to be able to raise more maxan in her community, since for her it is of great importance that her maxan plants produce leaves of first quality, and thus she won't lose the customers that she has.

One of her great aspirations is to plant more maxan plants and see her children flourish in the field of education and become professionals in life.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Hezeal

texts.en:
Hezeal is a single lady currently living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at schools in her community. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2013 because she wanted to be financially independent.

She began her business because she saw that it was very profitable in her community. Hezeal would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks, chick feed and drugs.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en: This is 34 year-old Kadie.  She is married, and has three children aged 6, 10 and 12 years old. In 2000, Kadie established her hair dressing salon. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in taking care of the family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Kadie requires a loan in order to improve her business by getting more plastic chairs, a deep freezer to sell soft drinks and pure water in the shop. She is using this tool to gain more customers. She also wants to buy magazines to read more about hair salons. In the future, she wants to cater to men, to establish another barbering salon. She appreciates you for your future support.

loans.use: to improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the shop by buying standing dryers, hand dryers, curling pins, rollers, etc.

loans.name: Brayan

texts.es:
Brayan es un hombre joden de 21 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es el servicio de chapa y pintura.
Él es inteligente, emprendedor, constante, de buen humor, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la zona ’16 de julio’ un lugar caracterizado por el creciente comercio en todas las áreas.
Brayan es de tez morena, cabello negro, estatura mediana, complexión delgada, su lengua materna es el aymara y el español. Su trabajo consiste en el arreglo de autos siniestrados, se encarga de quitar las abolladuras y pintarlo. Sus deseos de superación o han llevado a continuar sus estudios y se actualmente se encuentra cursando el segundo año de la carrera de derecho en la universidad pública, su hermana mayor es licenciada en enfermería  sus padres viven en la comunidad de ‘moco moco’ y se dedican a la agricultura. Su taller lo administra por las mañanas ya que por las tardes estudia, piensa en un futuro contratar a un empleado que se encargue del taller.
Su sueño es terminar su carrera y realizar una especialización en derecho penal. La dificultad que tiene es la falta de herramientas como una computadora para continuar con sus estudios.
Es por esos motivos que Brayan solicita un préstamo para la compra de una laptop y poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Brayan is a young man who is 21 years of age, single, and has no children. His business involves providing paint and body repair services.

Brayan is intelligent, enterprising, tenacious, good-humored, patient, responsible, and extremely hardworking. He works in the July 16th District, a place that is known for commercial growth in all areas.

Brayan is dark-skinned, has black hair, medium stature, and a slim build. His native languages are Aymara and Spanish. Brayan’s work involves repairing damaged cars. He is in charge of removing the dents from the vehicles and painting them. His drive to succeed has allowed him to continue his studies. He is currently finishing his second year toward a law degree at a public university. His older sister is a licensed nurse. His parents live in the community of “Moco Moco” and work in agriculture. Brayan operates his repair shop in the mornings and then studies in the afternoons. In the future, he plans to hire an employee to manage the repair shop.

His dream is to finish his degree and specialize in criminal law. His difficulty is the lack of equipment, such as a computer, so that he can continue his studies. For this reason, Brayan is requesting a loan in order to buy a laptop. This will help him to continue his studies.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer so that he can continue his studies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Cecilia. She is married and has three children aged 23, 20 and 7 years old. In 2006, Cecilia established her commercial rice, salt and oil business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in taking care of the children. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Cecilia requires a loan in order to expand the business, by buying 50 bags of rice, 30 bags of salt and 20 rubbers of oil all for resale. In the future, Cecilia plans to build a house on her land in Jui.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of rice, 30 bags of salt and 20 rubbers of oil all for resale.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 45-year-old Zainab. She is widowed and has one child aged seven years old. In 2006, Zainab established her palm oil and soft drinks business. She began her business because when her husband died she had nobody to help her so she decided to do business. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Zainab requires a loan in order to buy palm oil and soft drinks to improve her business. In the future, Zainab plans to open another outlet.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and soft drinks to improve her business.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 63 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Tita has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and earns additional income from selling rugs.

Tita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Charles  Yapo

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Charles. He is married and has 3 children aged 21,14 and 4 years old. 

In 2000 Charles established his provisions business. He began his business because he wanted to take care of his family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. Competition is very high because other shops are located in the same area, and this has caused a major challenge for him - how to meet the demands and choices of his customers?

He would like a loan to the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to improve his business. He is looking forward to funding as he requires more capital to meet the demands of his numerous customers, and he hopes that it will enable him to increase his monthly profits. 

In the future, Charles plans to extend the business by opening another outlet which will be managed by his wife. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: Sonia Doris

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 34 años con una excepcional familia con una niña de 5 años y un esposo que la apoya de manera incondicional. Por iniciativa propia comenzó su propio negocio de venta de cuyes en toda la zona de su ciudad, ella cría los cuyes en su casa y luego los vende a los distintos clientes, cree que le está yendo bien en el negocio porque la demanda es alta debido a que los platillos preparados con el cuy son muy deliciosos.
Sonia está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar más cuyes para criarlos y luego venderlos. Con esto su negocio mejorará y seguirá luchando para más adelante ver a su hija convertida en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 34-year-old woman with an exceptional family. She has a five-year-old daughter and a husband who support her unconditionally. Through her own initiative, Sonia started her a business of selling guinea pigs in all of the districts in her city. She raises the guinea pigs at home and then sells them to different customers. Sonia believes that she is doing well in her business because the demand is high since the dishes that are prepared with guinea pig are quite delicious.

Sonia is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have offered. She will buy more guinea pigs to raise so that she can sell them later. This will improve her business and she can continue to push forward so that her daughter can become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Ragiatu

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Ragiatu. She is widowed and has 2 children aged 16 and 7 years old. 

In 2002 Ragiatu established her palm oil, junk, water, and cosmetics business. She began her business because she wants to take care of her children since she is a single parent. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. She faces high competition, but her many years in the business enable her to excel.

She would like a loan to the amount of SLL 3,000,000 in order to improve her business. 

In the future, she plans to educate her children up to tertiary level.

loans.use: to improve her business

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious is single and lives in Hurungwe District. She works as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by improving their learning environment. Moreover, she attends meetings with students and she shares advice with them on how to improve their behavior. In addition, she rents a shop at the local business centre where she sells products like soap, sugar, cooking oil, Surf, flour and candles. She runs her grocery business to support her immediate family members.

loans.use: To purchase products like soap, sugar, cooking oil, Surf, flour and candles.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 56 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. She has been running the general store for 24 years and also earns an income from food vending. Cecilia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

loans.name: Arnida

texts.en:
Arnida is 63 years old and a widow with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Arnida has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. Arnida has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Arnida would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 32 years old and married with six children. Five of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elvie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Elvie has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Elvie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
Flordeluna is 30 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She also earns additional income from a general store.

Flordeluna is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Greathel

texts.en:
Greathel is 34 years old and married with three children, who are all attending school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Greathel runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Greathel has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, sardines, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Greathel would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is a hardworking farmer from Kinoni central cell Mbarara district. She is 52 years and her husband is 69 years.  He no longer has the ability to work and the responsibility to support the family is all left on the shoulders of this aging lady.

Two of her daughters are married but still she pays tuition for the two younger children, one of whom is yet to complete secondary school. She has a banana plantation from which she gets some income.  Nowadays, she has been hit hard by poor climatic conditions and the prevalence of pests and diseases,  in particular ‘todula’ (banana bacterial wilt), which is indiscriminately devastating people’s banana plantations.
 
Previously, she had taken a loan of 1,500,000 for school fees, which she serviced very well and is now requesting 2,000,000 to prevent her banana plantation from being destroyed.  She wants to buy farm manure and employ someone to stamp out all affected bananas. She is so thankful for the financial support. .

loans.use: To buy mulch and organic manure and hire labor

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Juan Carlos se sigue dedicando al negocio de confección de muebles, por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante, el sueño del es ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar melanina.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos continues to manage his furniture making business. Through this business, he is able to get ahead. His dream is to expand his furniture sales business.

Juan Carlos is requesting a loan in order to buy melamine particle board. He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy melamine particle board.

loans.name: G.s Las Palmas Group

texts.es:
La  señora Karen es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al negocio propio que es venta de ropa americana actividad que realiza desde hace 1 años, atiende su negocio todos los días de la semana, las ventas las realiza  en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante.
Doña Karen vende ropa, zapatos y cosméticos esta solicitando el préstamo para compra camisas, faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc. sueña con tener surtido su negocio porque se aproxima la temporada de la independencia y muchas personas le compran el producto que vende , esta solicita el préstamo de forma grupal y al igual que sus compañeras de grupo espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con sus familias.
Doña Sonia se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general desde hace 2 años.
Doña Irene se dedica a la venta de verduras y cerdos desde hace 20 años.
Doña Norma se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace 5 años.

Danlí, Honduras – Agosto del 2014
texts.en:
Karen is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her own business which is selling American clothing, a job she has done for 1 year, she works in her business every day of the week, the sales are done in the house where she lives and on foot.

Karen sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She is applying for a loan to buy shirts, skirts, dresses, blouses, trousers, etc. She dreams of having her business stocked because the Independence season is drawing closer and many people will buy the product that she sells. She is requesting a loan in a group and just like her group members she hopes that this input will enable them to earn the necessary income to move forward with their families.

Sonia has worked in general store sales for 2 years.
Irene has worked in fruit and pig sales for 20 years.
Norma has worked selling clothing and cosmetics for 5 years.

Danlí, Honduras – August 2014

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, dresses, blouses, trousers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 29 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Hazel has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more corn to sell.

Hazel has been in this business for two years. In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more corn to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fish.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 30 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Hazel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Hazel has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

Josephine has been in this business for six years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Jenny Rose

texts.en:
Jenny Rose is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenny Rose has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Jenny Rose has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Jenny Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dressed chicken in the Philippine, and earns additional income from her general store.  Lourdes is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more meat and dressed chicken to sell in her food stall.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more meat and dressed chicken to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Duhuze Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline fait partie du groupe  Duhuze et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 40 ans et est mariée à Déo,un Chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 1 à 17 ans dont 5 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 3 enfants membres de sa famille élargie qui étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique(cahiers,chaussures,...) depuis  12 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d'articles de sa boutique( des cahiers,des chaussures,...) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait devenir une commerçante importatrice ,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the Duhuze group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 40 years old and married to Deo, who is a driver. They have six children between the ages of one and 17, of whom five go to school.

She also has three  children from her extended family who are dependent on her, and who are students.

 She has been a shopkeeper (exercise books, shoes…) for 12 years.

 This is her second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of goods for her shop (exercise books, shoes…) for resale to earn more.

 In the coming years, she would like to become an importation retailer and see her children through school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of goods for her shop (exercise books, shoes…) for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Ketty Karina

texts.es:
Kety es una vendedora de electrodomésticos con más de 10 años de experiencia, aprendió empíricamente y comenzó con la profesión ante la falta de oportunidades en una empresa pues no tenía los estudios requeridos.
Ella llega donde le abran las puertas y la que encuentra cerrada la abre, siempre busca como vender como sobrevivir pues de esto vive y con este negocio mantiene a sus 2 hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad.
Trabaja todos los días pues cada vez son más los gastos que tiene, solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía, el monto lo justifica pues los artículos son caros y necesita varios para tener una rentabilidad visible.
Sueña con poder tener un local comercia y dejar de ser ambulante para tener tiempo para sus hijos y estar cerca de ellos.
texts.en:
Ketty has more than than 10 years' experience selling electrical appliances. She learnt this trade by trial and error, and began after facing the lack of opportunities at her company because she didn't have the necessary educational background. She has arrived at a place where doors can be opened, and she opens ones previously found shut. She is always looking to sell in order to survive, as this is her livelihood, and through this business she supports her two children, aged 13 and 8.

Ketty works every day as she has more and more costs to cover. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise. She justifies her loan as the items are expensive, and she needs several to achieve a visible profitability. Her dream is to have retail premises and stop selling as an itinerant trader so she can have time for her children and be near them.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances such as blenders, coffee makers and sandwich makers, looking to have premises to be near to her children.

loans.name: Candida Yanira

texts.es: Candida de 40 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas de 24 y 15 años de edad la mayor  trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de mariscos y pescados su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su casa en un lugar muy transitado por eso posee mucha clientela, Candida está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mariscos y pescados por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Candida is 40 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own house with her daughters, who are 24 and 15 years old. The older one works and helps her economically.

For many years, Candida has worked selling seafood and fish. Her business is close to her home, in a very busy place. Therefore, she as many customers.

Candida asks for a loan to buy more seafood and fish wholesale, in order to be able to continue her sales and by this to get a better income.

loans.use: to buy more seafood and fish wholesale.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namapa Província de Nampula tem 51 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de 3 filho, todos frequenta a escola, responsabiliza-se pelo seu sobrinho que vive em sua casa.
É Mecânico e negociante a mais de 5 anos ,faz  o seu negocio no mercado informal de  compra de  sapatos usados para a revenda onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende ampliar  o seu negócio. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende adquirir uma viatura para o transporte da sua mercadoria.
texts.en: Fernando was born in Namapa Province in Nampula.  He is 51 years old, married, and father of  3 children who all attend school.  He also supports his nephew who lives with him.  He is a mechanic and has had a retail business for over 5 years.  His business is in the informal market, where he buys used shoes and resells them for money that he uses to pay household expenses.  With this loan he hopes to grow his business.  This is his 4th loan with Hluvuku.  In the future he hopes to purchase a car to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase used shoes for resale.

loans.name: Vuka Group

texts.fr:
Jules fait partie du groupe  Vuka et  habite à Bujumbura . Il a 38 ans et est marié à Viola ,une cultivatrice Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 4 à 9ans,dont  2 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge 1 enfant membre de sa famille élargie,  qui étudie.

Il fait le commerce de  planches  depuis  4 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu'il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  planches  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter un terrain cultivable et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jules is a member of the Vuka group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 38 years old and married to Viola, who is a farmer. They have three children between the ages of four and nine, two of whom go to school.
He has one dependent child from his extended family, who is a student.

He has been selling planks for four years.

This is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that he requests, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of planks for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy some farmable land and see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of planks for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Jangamo Província de Inhambane tem 41 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 6 filhos apenas 1 é maior de idade todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus pais que se encontram em Inhambane.
É carpinteiro, proprietário de uma carpintaria onde  ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e na sua obra de residência. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo madeira para sua carpintaria. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende ampliar a sua carpintaria e adquirir uma viatura para o transporte de material.
texts.en: Fernando was born in Jangamo Province of  Inhambane. He is 41 years old and married with 6 children. One is an adult and all of them attend school. He also supports his parents who live in Inhambane. He is a carpenter, owner of a carpentry business where he earns money to pay for household expenses and construction on his home. With this loan he plans to grow his business by acquiring wood for his carpentry shop.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku.  In the future he would like to expand his business and get a vehicle to transport materials.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane tem 26 anos de idade vive maritalmente pai de 1 filha menor de idade responsabiliza-se pelos seus pais que se encontram em Inhambane enviando lhes mensalmente um valor de 1000mt.
Trabalha como operador de máquinas na empresa Águas de Namaacha a mais de 2 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende adquirir um imóvel. Este é seu 1º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende reabilitar a sua casa e garantir o bem estar da sua família.
texts.en: Fernando was born in Inhambane.  He is 26 years old, married, and father to one daughter.  He also supports his parents who live in Inhambane by sending them 1000mt per month.  He has worked as a machine operator for Águas de Namaacha  for more than 2 years.  He earns a salary that he uses for household expenses.  With this loan he will purchase property.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku.  In the future he plans to repair his home to ensure the well being of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a property.

loans.name: Twunguke Ii Group

texts.fr:
Didace  fait partie du groupe  TwungukeII et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 27 ans et est marié à Emelyne ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 1 à 2 ans.
Il a sous sa charge 1 enfant membre de sa famille élargie ,qui étudie. 

Il fait le commerce des habits  depuis  10 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d' habits à  revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  construire une maison d'habitation,faire le commerce de boutique ,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Didace is a member of the TwungukeII group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 27 years old and married to Emelyne, who is a farmer. They have two children between the ages of one and two.
He has one dependent child from his extended family, who is a student.

He has been selling clothing for ten years.

This is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that he requests, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothing for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to build a house to live in, work in a shop, and send his children to school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothing for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Cristiano

texts.pt:
o senhor  Cristiano é comerciante tem 28 anos de idade , casado, pai de 2 filhos ainda menores de idade vive na casa própria, sustenta 1 irmao que vive com ele e sua mãe enviando.
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar refrigerantes, cervejas, para reforçar o seu negócio.
Projecto para o futuro diz que quer terminar sua obra e fazer outra num espaco que ja adiquiriu, arrendar a casa onde actualmente vive e crescer no seu negócio.
Diz que seus desafios são  financeiros e para minimizar ira solicitar mais empréstimos para suprir as dificuldades e alcancar o seu sonho.
texts.en: Cristiano has a retail business.  He is 28 years old, married, and has 2 young children.  He owns his home and also supports a brother who lives with him, and his mother by sending money.  With this loan he will purchase soft drinks and beer to restock his business. In the future he wants to finish building his house and build another on a property that he purchased, rent the house he is currently living in, and grow his business. His greatest challenges are financial, so to minimize this he will request additional loans to overcome difficulties and achieve his dream.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Filipe

texts.pt:
O senhor Filipe e professor tem 36 anos de idade , pai de 2 filhos que frequentam o ensino primario,  vive na casa própria 
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar loiça sanitária, tijoleira  para dar continuidade a sua obra construcao de sua casa.
Projecto para o futuro diz que quer terminar sua obra para dar um lar melhor a sua familia e  por fim construir uma barraca para reforcar a renda familiar.
Diz que seus desafios sao  financeiros e para minimizar este facto ira solicitar mais empréstimos para suprir as dificuldades e implementar o seu projecto futuro.
texts.en: Filipe is a professor who is 36 years old.  He has two children who attend primary school.  He owns his home.  With this loan he will purchase bathroom tile and floor tiles to continue construction on his house.  In the future he wants to finish construction to provide a better home for his family and finally build a small restaurant to support the family income.  His primary obstacles are financial, so he will continue to request loans to overcome these difficulties and implement his future projects.

loans.use: to purchase bathroom tiles and floor tiles.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica desde hace 8 años a la elaboración de pan francés, la panadería la tiene ubicada en su lugar de residencia y posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija de 3 años de edad, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, latas, moldes, etc.  para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face has been blurred in the picture above is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has worked for 8 years making French bread. He has his bakery at his home and has many customers, because he offers good prices. He lives in his own home with his partner and their 3-year-old daughter.

He asks for a loan to buy flour, baking trays, molds, etc., in order to e able to continue his work and to get a better income.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking trays, molds, etc.

loans.name: Liz Zayda

texts.es: Liz es una joven de 23 años de edad que estudia la carrera de ingeniería industrial por 05 años. Desde muy pequeña le agrado la carrera industrial ver el proceso de nuevos productos, sus transformaciones y procesos. Es por eso que ella es aplicada en su carrera y se siente feliz. Su mayor deseo es poder insertarse al mercado laboral y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida.  El préstamo que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de una laptop.  Liz está muy agradecida a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Liz is a 23-year-old woman who has been studying industrial engineering for five years. Since she was a child, she wanted to work in industry, to see how new products were made, processed and transformed. For this reason, she is very committed to her career and is happy. 

Her greatest desire is to be able to find her place in the labor market and, by this, to improve her quality of life. 

The loan she asks for will be used to buy a laptop. Liz is very grateful to Kiva lendes for making this loan possible.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Entente De Kuiti Group

texts.fr:
Mr Boureima est le représentant du groupe ENTENTE DE KUITI. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 05 enfants, le plus âgé a 13 ans et le moins âgé a 21 mois. 03 vont à l’école. Il a 2 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est agriculteur depuis 15 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les commerçants des villes voisines.
Il  veut s’acheter 02 sacs d’arachides, 05 boites d’insecticide, 03 sacs d’engrais.
Mr Boureima veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour accroitre  son activité et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Boureima is the leader of the Entente de Kuiti group. He is very well. He is married with five children, the oldest is 13 and the youngest is 21 months old.

Three of them attend school, and he has two dependent people.

Mr. Boureima has been a farmer for 15 years. He buys his stock at the local markets. His customers are merchants from neighbouring towns.

He would like to buy two sacks of peanuts, five tins of insecticide, and three sacks of fertiliser.

Mr. Boureima wants to use his profits to expand his business and take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of peanuts, five cans of insecticide, and three sacks of fertiliser.

loans.name: Idila

texts.pt:
A senhora Idila  é cabelereira  tem 31 anos de idade ,casada, mãe  de 1 filho que frequenta o ensino primario vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar chapa de zinco  portas,areia cimento, loica sanitaria, barrotes, tinta e  para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Projecto para o futuro diz que quer terminar sua obra para dar uma melhor comodidade a sua famili a e concluir o seu salao cabeleleiro para dar melhores condicoes de atendimento aos seus clientes.
Diz que seus desafios sao  financeiros e para minimiza- los ira solicitar mais empréstimos para suprir as dificuldades e alcancar o seu sonho.
texts.en: Idila  is a hairdresser.  She is 31 years old, married, and has one son who attends primary school.  She owns her home.  With this loan she will purchase zinc panels, doors, sand, cement, bathroom fixtures, bars, and paint to continue construction.  He future project is to complete construction to provide her family with more comfort and finish her hair salon to provide a better environment for her customers. She says her challenges are financial. In order to minimize them she will request more loans to overcome obstacles and achieve her dream.

loans.use: to purchase zinc panels, sand, cement, bathroom fixtures, bars, paint, and bathroom tile.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
A senhora Luisa de 56 anos de idade é  comerciante mãe de 6 filhos  já maiores de idade com suas próprias casas tem 5 netos sob sua responsabilidade.
O cliente pretende com o valor comprar tijoleira, cimento cola, tubos para grades cantoneiras areia fina, para dar continuidade a construcao de sua casa.
 Diz que seu sonho e concluir sua obra  e mobilar, fazer dependências para arrendar como forma de reforçar a renda familiar.
Os principais desafios que enfrenta são financeiros e pretende trabalhar mais com a Hluvuku para superar  suas dificuldades.
texts.en: Luisa is 56 years old and owns a retail business. She has 6 children who are all adults with houses of their own.  She supports 5 grandchildren.  She is requesting a loan to purchase floor tiles, mortar, fencing, and fine sand to continue construction on her house. Her dream is to finish construction and furnish her home, and to build other buildings to rent out in order to increase the family income.  Her main obstacles are financial so she plans to work with Hluvuku again to overcome her difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase floor tiles, mortar, fencing, and fine sand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more lottery tickets

loans.name: Simiao

texts.pt:
O senhor Simião de 37 anos de idade é  alfaiate casado, pai de 3 filhos  dos quais 2 frequentam o ensino primário e 1 ainda e menor.
O cliente pretende com o valor comprar um novo portão para colocar no muro de sua casa.
 Diz que seu sonho e concluir sua casa melhorar as condicoes de sua alfaiataria fazer parcerias com grandes empresas fazendo encomendas de uniformes de trabalho.
Os principais desafios que enfrenta sao financeiros e pretende trabalhar mais com a hluvuku para superar  suas dificuldades.
texts.en: Simião is 37 years old and works as a tailor.  He is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom attend primary school and one who is still too young.  He is requesting a loan to put a new gate in the wall around his home. His dream is to finish his house and improve his tailoring shop so he can take orders from large businesses such as orders for work uniforms. His main challenges are financial, so he plans to work with Hluvuku again to overcome those difficulties.

loans.use: para comprar um novo portão

loans.name: Fausta

texts.pt:
A senhora Fausta é comerciante tem 52 anos de idade, mae casada de 4 filhos dos quais 3 ja maiores de idade outra ainda a estudar  vive na casa própria 
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar loiça sanitaria, tijoleira  para dar continuidade a sua obra construcao de sua casa.
Projecto para o futuro diz que quer terminar sua obra para dar um lar melhor a sua familia e mobilar e por fim construir uma barraca para incrementar a renda familiar.
Diz que seus desafios sao  financeiros e para minimizar ira solicitar mais empréstimos para suprir as dificuldades e implementar seu projecto futuro.
texts.en: Fausta has a retail business.  She is 52 years old, married, and has 4 children, 3 of whom who are adults and one who is still in school.  She owns her home.  She will use this loan to purchase bathroom fixtures and floor tiles to continue construction on her home.  In the future she wants to finish construction in order to provide a better home to her family, furnish it, and build a small restaurant to increase the family income. Her primary challenges are financial so she will request additional loans to overcome difficulties and implement her future plans.

loans.use: to purchase bathroom fixtures and floor tiles.

loans.name: Ankato-Allama Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe Ankato-allama sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kolondièba, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser. Mme Sanata  1ère personne à gauche sur la photo compte acheter avec son prêt 20 pagnes. Elle vend à travers la ville de Kolondièba et à la maison. Elle s’approvisionne à Kolondièba et à Bamako. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientele mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA.Ce bénéfice va la permettre de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Ankato-allama group are married women who, on average, are 32 years old and have three children. They all live in polygamous families in Kolondièba, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better conduct their businesses. They are on their seventh loan and intend to pay it back.

Sanata, who is the first person on the left in the photo, plans to buy 20 pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]. She makes her sales across the town of Kolondièba and from her home, for cash and sometimes for credit, to a mixed group of customers. She procures her goods from Kolondièba and from Bamako. 

Sanata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA. These earnings are going to allow her to pay back [her part of] the loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Tièssiri sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  33 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kolondièba, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.Mme  Mawa  1ère personne à gauche sur la photo compte acheter avec son prêt 5 colis de condiments. 
Elle vend quotidiennement au marché et à la maison.Elle s’approvisionne à Kolondièba et à Bamako. Elle vend au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000FCFA.Ce bénéfice va la permettre de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Tièssiri group are married women who, on average, are 33 years old and have three children. They all live in polygamous families in Kolondièba, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better conduct their businesses. They are on their sixth loan and intend to repay it.

Mawa, who is the first person standing on the left in the photo, plans to buy five packages of condiments with her loan. She sells her products daily for cash at a market and from home to a mixed group of customers. She procures her goods in Kolondièba and from Bamako. 

Mawa hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA. These earnings will allow her to pay back [her part of] the loan and to also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Nueva Ventilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA VENTILLA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Bertha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de cerveza, costura de faldas, tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas, taller de cerrajería, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Bertha es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que la visito en su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de librería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace un año aprendiendo el mismo de su madre. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material escolar por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Ventanilla” communal association will start its first cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the regional office in Senkata. It has eight members and is directed by a board, of which Bertha is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association run are varied and include selling meat, selling beer, sewing skirts, a neighborhood store, knitting sweaters, a locksmith's workshop, and a bookstore.

The loan they will take out will benefit a group of small business owners of which Bertha is a member. She says that this is the first time she's been part of Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of an advisor of the institution who visited her in her home. She currently has a bookstore business; she says that she started this business a year ago and learned it from her mother.
 
The loan she will take out is to increase capital (to buy school supplies wholesale), which she will buy from wholesalers and then sell in her store. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is single and has a son.

When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF in order to buy more fish and other ingredients.

Merlinda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her enterprise. NWTF is presenting Merlinda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making dried fish.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 57 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Perla has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El medio ambiente forma parte importante en el planeta y es bueno saber que aun hay personas que se dedican a cuidar el medio ambiente como un actividad productivo tal es el caso de Domingo que desde muy pequeño tiene ese deseo de plantar en su comunidad, el es de 50 años de edad  que tiene 2 hijos el primero es de 9 años de edad es estudiante en su comunidad y el último de dos años de edad que aun no estudia.

La actividad que Domingo ha venido realizando desde hace 21 años es la plantación de café y el lo aprendió de sus padres ya que es la única herencia que ellos le dejaron y es por ello que el se a dedicado de la plantación de los mismos para poder tener un ingreso económico para su familia e obtener ganancias para el sustento de su familia.

El propósito de la realización del préstamo de Domingo es para la compra de terreno que le están ofreciendo ya que un tiempo atrás el ha venido tratando de comprar dicho terreno para poder dejar un bonito recuerdo a sus hijos para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada.

Domingo quiere ser diferente que sus padres y uno de sus más grandes aspiraciones por el futuro es la construcción de viviendas para sus hijos para que vivan en condiciones adecuadas y bridarles estudios para que ellos sean profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
The environment is an important part of our planet and it's good to know that there are still people who are dedicated to looking after the environment as a productive activity. This is what Domingo does and ever since he was little he has had this desire to farm in his community. Now he is 50 years old and has two children. The first is 9 years old and studies at the local school and the second is 2 years old and does not study yet.  

Domingo's occupation since he was 21 years old has been the cultivation of coffee. He learned his trade from his parents - the only legacy that they left him. For this reason he has been working in the fields which belonged to his parents in order to earn an income and ensure the upkeep of his family. 

The purpose of the loan that Domingo is requesting is to buy land that is being offered to him. He has been trying to buy this land for some time as he wishes to leave something nice for his children so that they can have what they need to live adequately. 

Domingo wants to be different to his parents. One of his greatest aspirations for the future is to build homes for his children so that they can have adequate living conditions and to provide them with education so that they can be professionals later in life.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Jescyl

texts.en:
Jescyl is 38 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jescyl has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Jescyl has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 55 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar and soap. In the future Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teiber

texts.es:
Teiber tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres. Él vive en la distrito de Pucará, el cual es un distrito mediano on aspiraciones a superarse, cuyas actividades principales son el comercio y la agricultura, y está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Teiber se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual trabaja, realiza servicio de transporte público en el distrito de Pucará y caseríos cercanos, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro.
