Teiber es natural de Pucará, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, laborales y económicas, tiene solvencia moral y económica, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil, asegurando de esta forma el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, para poder seguir generando ingresos y así poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teiber is 28 years old, is single, and lives with his parents.  He lives in the district of Pucará, which is a medium sized district with aspirations for growth. The principle commercial activities in the region include trade and agriculture.  The town of Pucará is located in the province of Jaén, the region of Cajamarca, and the northern mountains of Perú.

Teiber works offering transportation services.  He has his own motorcycle taxi that he uses for work.  He offers transportation in the district of Pucará and neighboring towns.  He has more than five years of experience on this route.

Teiber is originally from Pucará and he has very strong personal, work and economic references. He is solvent both morally and economically. He plans to use his loan to invest in the maintenance of his vehicle in order to ensure the proper function of the tool of his trade.  This will allow him to continue generating income and eventually obtain an even better vehicle in order to improve his business and his quality of life.

loans.use: To invest in the maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Samson Jr.

texts.en:
Samson Jr. is a 17-year-old single man from a village near Pagadian City. He lives with his family in a humble house. His father is a worker and gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Samson Jr. is a student in a local college where he studies Engine Watch Keeping. He would like to finish his study and wants to become a seaman someday.

Samson Jr. took a loan from Gata Daku MPC. This loan will help him to pay the university tuition fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Samson Jr. will be able to complete his study.

loans.use: to pay the university tuition fees for this semester.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling dry goods. 

Rebecca is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely is a 62-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nely has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Nely requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Nely has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Nely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 34 years old, married, and  has one child who is in school.  

Ruby is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ruby has been raising pigs for two years now, and she has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ruby requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Ruby would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a 62-year-old widowed woman with five children, one still in school, and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

For 16 years, Fe has operated a sand and gravel sales business in the Philippines. Fe requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional tonnage of sand and gravel to sell.  Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional tonnage of sand and gravel to sell.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Almuerzos diarios y pasteles semanalmente, es lo que vende Abel desde hace 1 año,  para generar ingresos y sostener a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo. Su idea de negocio surgió de su propia experiencia, cuando fue en la busqueda de almuerzos para su familia un dia festivo y no obtuvo resultado alguno. Con la necesidad de su potencial clientela, empezó a invertir en la compra de insumos de alimentos y a elaborar almuerzos. Poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo pues su vecindad lo fue conociendo y con ello extendiendo su fama por todos los alrededores. Hoy no se detiene su reconocimeinto en el mercado, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr responderle a todos los que desean comprarle; esto es justamente lo que hace que Abel se acerque a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un credikiva, primer finacimeinto que hace a  esta organización, mediante el cual compará un fogon e inusmos, para que la forma de coccion sea mas ágil y la productividad aumente tal como lo espera su distinguida clientela.
texts.en:
A year ago, Abel started selling daily lunches and pastries every week. He does this work to generate income to support his family consisting of his spouse and his small child. 

His idea for this business came out of his own experience when he went out on a holiday to find lunch for his family, but to no avail. To meet the demand of potential customers, he began to invest in the purchase of food items and to prepare lunches. His business picked up gradually as the neighbors got to know him and spread his fame beyond to the surrounding areas. 

Nowadays his customer recognition continues to expand, but his working capital is not enough to satisfy the growing demand. This is why Abel approached the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he is requesting the first loan from this institution to buy a stove and food supplies. This will allow for faster cooking and increased production, as expected by his excellent customers.

loans.use: to buy a stove and food supplies.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Adela successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

NWTF is listing Adela's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna, 31, is a married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elna has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years.

Elna requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing equipment and repair her fishing boat.

In the future, Elna would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Alejandra works hard to support her family.  She operates a rice and feed retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  

Alejandra is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice and feed to sell for her retail business.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice and feed to sell.

loans.name: Ageda

texts.en:
Ageda is 50 years old, married, and has 12 children. With four children in school, Ageda works very hard to provide for them.

Ageda's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Ageda has restarted her nipa-making business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ageda has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ageda is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to put up other business to save money.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, el se dedica desde hace 10 años al cultivo de maíz y a la venta de ganado, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive en casa propia con su padre y su hermana, el joven está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia para continuar con sus cultivos y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young man has had his face pixelated because he is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has made a living for ten years growing corn and selling livestock. He sells his products in the different markets that are near his home. He lives in his own home with his father and his sister. 

The young man is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc., and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph to continue with his farming and so give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Mirabel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mirabel works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling medicines. Mirabel has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Mirabel is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell at her general store.

 She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 29 years old, married, and has two children, who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gina's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Gina is taking out a 10,000 Philippine peso housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Gina has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 53 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Josephine has been farming rice for twenty years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Josephine is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 68 years old and a widow with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Violeta has a beauty parlor shop business in the Philippines. Violeta has been in this business for three years.

Violeta requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her beauty parlor. 

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF.

Virginia is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish for her dried-fish business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida  is a widow and has four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients hence the perishable nature of goods can lead to losses.

With the 15,000 KES she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Elena is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Ma. Elena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Elena requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients and additional materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Ma. Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 45 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Agnes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Agnes has borrowed and repaid 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from food vending and pig fattening.

Agnes aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maribon

texts.en:
Maribon is 43 years old. Maribon is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Maribon is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Maribon requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Maribon has been raising livestock for 1 year now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Maribon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 33 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming mangoes in the Philippines. Analiza is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Analiza has been farming mangoes for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.

Angelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, eggs, biscuits, candies, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store business.  She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items like canned goods, eggs, biscuits, candies, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 45 years old and married with six children; three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marlyn is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Marlyn has been farming rice for twenty years and she earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es: Se acerca la temporada en la cual se celebra el amor y la amistad y con ello el incremento de las ventas en el negocio de miscelanea y papelería de Beatriz. Así su capital de trabajo resulta ser insuficiente, para atender la demanda que trae consigo esta época, pues todos quieren comprar detalles, para regalar a sus amigos, novios o familiares y celebrar con ellos. Con este negocio Beatriz lleva 3 años de experiencia y con él ha ido de menos a mas, y esto ha sido posible gracias a que que Beatriz desde muy niña y con padres comerciantes le insculcaron la tradicion de trabajar de manera independiente y eso es lo que ella ha logrado desde que inició con su negocio, donde vende desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche desde los lunes hasta los sabados; con su mayor esmero, Beatriz pone a disposición articulos que los consumidores de su barrio, no encuentran en otros lugares cercanos, y ella les ofrece los mejores precios, pues compra directamente de contado a comerciantes mayoristas. En la actualidad  Beatriz se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar  a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a esta organización mediante el cual comprará articulos de miscelaneas como accesorios femeninos, detalles para el hogar, papelería entre otras mercancias, para impactar sus ventas y hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa, porque mejora las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Beatriz has 3 years of experience with this business and with it, she has gone from less to more. This has been possible thanks to that Beatriz from a very little girl and with traders for parents was instilled with the tradition of working independently. 

That is what she has been able to do since she began her business where she sells from 9 in the morning until 8 at night from Monday through Saturday. With her greatest care, Beatriz offers items to the consumers in her neighborhood that they cannot find in other nearby places, and she offers the best prices because she purchases wholesale directly from wholesalers. 

Currently, Beatriz has approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has requested from this organization. Through this she will purchase miscellaneous articles such as feminine accessories, little gifts for the home, and stationery, among other merchandise to impact her sales and to make her Kiva loan a successful investment because it will improve her business’s conditions.

loans.use: to purchase miscellaneous items such as feminine accessories, little gifts for the home, and stationery, among other merchandise.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a Taxi driver from the Mbarara district. He is married with one child, albeit having four other children in their early teens under his care.
His son is only two years and the children with whom he lives are orphans from his village whose relatives were unable to care for them.

On top of being a Taxi driver, he also operates a restaurant in Ruti under the supervision of his wife.  To be more competitive in the market he has approached Ugafode for more financial assistance to help him again. He wishes to expand the business to a higher standard so as to compete favourably. He wants to purchase presentable seats, tables and other up-to-date kitchenware.

He has been good at repaying his previous loans and we are seeking for assistance for his rescue.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and kitchenware.

loans.name: G.s La Fortaleza De Moroceli Group

texts.es:
El señor José es un hombre emprendedor y dedicado al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de su negocio venta de ropa americana actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años, las ventas las realiza todos los días de la semana.
Don José vende ropa de niño, mujer, hombre y sus clientes principales son personas que habitan en el municipio, y personas de diferentes aldeas cercanas al municipio, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blusas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, faldas, etc. sueña que atreves de las ganancias que obtenga de su trabajo sus hijos puedan graduarse en la escuela y al igual que sus compañeros de grupo espera que esta inversión les genere las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante con su familia.
Don Ramón se dedica a la venta de carne de res y cerdo desde hace 1 año.
Doña Iscela se dedica a la venta de leche y cuajada  desde hace 7 años.
Doña Martha se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general desde hace 7 años. 

Danlí, Honduras – Septiembre del 2014
texts.en:
Jose is an entrepreneur dedicated to his business. His primary source of income is made by selling American style clothes. He has had this business for three years and sells every day of the week. He sells clothes for men, women and children and his main clientele are people who live in the area or from towns nearby. He is requesting a loan to buy more blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, etc. He dreams that through the gained earnings from this loan be able to support his children through school. Also important to Jose is his group partners. He hopes this investment will also help his partners have success and improve the well-being of their family. 
Ramon has been selling beef and pork for one year.
Iscela has been selling milk and curd for 7 years. 
Marth has worked at a grocery store for 7 years.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, etc., for his business.

loans.name: Dungaamaa

texts.en:
Dungaamaa, 49 years old, lives with her husband and youngest child at her sister's home in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

She has been working as a seller at a jeans shop since 2009. Her husband is disabled due to disease and stays at home, taking care of the domestic work. Their youngest son works as a loader at a construction site. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to buy a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) in order to live in a comfortable and spacious place.  

In the profile picture, the borrower is shown together with her disabled husband.

loans.use: to buy a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling).

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and successfully repaid her previous loans from Gata Daku MPC in full. Marilou has borrowed and repaid five loans from GDMPC before this loan, and she used those loans for her retail business.

She took a new loan recently to purchase additional stocks of supplies for her general store. She has been running the store for many years. Improving the business is her passion because she wants to have a stable source of income for the family in the near future. Marilou aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Salita

texts.en:
Salita is 41 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Salita works very hard to provide for them.

Salita's business and family home was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Salita has restarted her nipa-making business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Salita has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for labor to do the construction.

Salita is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Octavio Alberto

texts.es:
Octavio es un hombre de 36 años de edad que tiene como profesión ser el locutor de la emisora del batallón del ejército de su sector, paralelo a esta profesión atendiendo las necesidades de sus compañeros militares y viendo en esta una oportunidad de generar ingresos comenzó a venderles lociones, tenis y ropa ya que él puede salir del batallón para facilitarles el trabajo pues sus salidas son muy restringidas.
Solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de lociones, tenis, ropa para sus compañeros satisfaciéndolos y brindadores un buen servicio puesto que a pesar de que están defiendo la patria también tiene su vanidad y derecho de estar bien presentados.
texts.en:
Octavio, age 36, is the announcer for the army battalion radio station in his area.  In addition to this profession, he sees to the needs of his colleagues in the military by selling them lotions, tennis shoes, and clothes.  He started doing this as an opportunity to generate income.  He is able to leave the battalion to facilitate his work, but their outings are very restricted.

He is requesting the loan to buy lotions, tennis shoes, and clothes to satisfy his colleagues and provide them with a good service.  In spite of the fact that they are defending their country, they have their vanity and the right to look nice.

loans.use: to buy lotions, tennis shoes, and clothes.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is 23 years old and married with one child who is in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sandy has been raising pigs for five years and she earns additional income from fishing.

Sandy is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  Kototala sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Tousseguela, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.Mme   Kadiatou    debout au milieu sur la photo compte acheter avec son prêt 4 colis de condiments. Elle vend à Kolondièba et  s’approvisionne à Kolondièba auprès des grossistes et forains venant des villages environnants. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA.Ce bénéfice va la permettre de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kototala group are married women who on average are 34 years old and have four children. They all live in polygamous families in Tousseguela, one of the sub-prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to ensure good management of their activities. This is their eighth loan from the institution and they have the firm intention of repaying it. Mrs. Kadiatou, who is standing in the middle in the photo, plans to buy four packets of condiments with her loan. She sells her goods in Kolondièba and also buys her stock there from wholesalers and stall-holders from the neighbouring villages. She sells for cash and sometimes for credit to a mixed clientele. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25.000FCFA. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to assist her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is in need of more capital to invest in her retail store so she can renovate her store and purchase more goods to offer to her customers. This loan will allow her to increase her stock levels, have a more comfortable place, and increase the hygiene standards. She wishes to continue working and generating income to get ahead with her family, which is an incentive for her to better manage her profits.

With her previous loan, she was able to offer her customers more products. Her sales and profits have improved and her family lives a comfortable life.
Teresita decided to request a new loan because of the positive effects it generates. This loan will help her to purchase a greater variety of grocery goods to sell. She wants to offer more goods each time her costumers visit in order to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Gladys successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is presenting Gladys' business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs to maintain his crops and livestock.

loans.name: Inyenyeri Yo Mubuseruko Group

texts.fr:
Désiré  fait partie du groupe  Inyenyeriyomubuseruko et  habite à  Bujumbura . Il a 35 ans et est marié à Jeanine ,une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 10 ans,dont 3 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge sa mère et sa sœur.

Il exploite son salon de coiffure  depuis  15 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième crédit à Turame.Avec le crédit Kiva qu'il obtient,il va augmenter son capital et acheter des tondeuses pour son  salon de coiffure.  

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  ouvrir un autre salon au centre ville ,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Desiré is a member of the Inyenyeriyomubuseruko group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 35 and married to Jeanine, who is a saleswoman. They have four children between the ages of one and ten, of whom three go to school.

He also supports his mother and his sister.

He has been running a hairdressing salon for 15 years.

This is his second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that he requests, he will increase his capital and purchase clippers for his salon.

In the coming years, he would like to open another salon in the town centre and see his children through school.

loans.use: increase his capital and purchase clippers for his salon.

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en: Maylinda finds pleasure in doing her farming activities. Not only that, she is doing her hobby with her husband, and she earns an income as well. At the age of 31 and married, Maylinda keeps herself busy in order to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a better mother for her children. She credits GDMPC for providing her with capital to support her farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, Maylinda wishes to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Shiela works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane. Sheila is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Sheila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Arlene

texts.en:
Ma. Arlene is 38 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Ma. Arlene has previously borrowed and paid eleven loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Ma. Arlene aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Koglweogo Group

texts.fr:
Mr Inoussa est le représentant du groupe KOGLWEOGO. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 06 enfants, le plus âgé a 18 ans et le moins âgé a 26 mois. 04 vont à l’école. Il a 6 personnes en charge
Monsieur est jardinier depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les revendeurs venant des pays voisins.
Il  veut s’acheter 05 boites de semences de d’oignons, et 05 sacs d’engrais.
Mr Inoussa veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour augmenter sa production et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Inoussa is the leader of the Koglweogo group. He is doing fine. He is married with six children, the oldest is 18 and the youngest 26 months. Four of them go to school. He supports six people.

Mr. Inoussa has been a gardener for ten years. He buys his supplies from the local markets. His customers are the retailers from neighbouring countries.

He would like to buy five boxes of onion seeds, and five sacks of fertiliser. Mr. Inoussa wants to use his profits to increase his production and to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of onion seeds, and five sacks of fertiliser.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn finds pleasure in her multiple businesses like growing crabs and fish, and a general store. With this business, she earns enough for her to provide for her family. She successfully repaid her previous loan which she used in her store to purchase goods to sell.  She's always finding ways to augment her retail business.

She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store. She is hoping to earn more income for her family. She wishes to properly manage her business in order to improve, in the near future, her family's general living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries, vegetables, etc.) for her store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 48 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Norma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 60 years old and married with three children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Felomina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Felomina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vive Le Paysan Peele Group

texts.fr:
Mr Saidou est le représentant du groupe VIVE LE PAYSAN PEELE. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 12 enfants, le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. 06 vont à l’école. Il a 20 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est agriculteur depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les commerçants des villes voisines.
Il  veut s’acheter 10 sacs d’engrais et 20 litres d’essence.
Mr Saidou veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour accroitre  son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Saidou is the leader of the Vive Le Paysan Peele group. He is doing fine. He is married with 12 children, the oldest is 22 and the youngest is one year old. Six of them go to school. He supports 20 people.
Mr. Saidou has been a farmer for ten years. He buys his supplies from the local markets. His customers are the merchants from neighbouring towns.
He would like to buy 10 sacks of fertiliser, and 20 litres of petrol.
Mr. Saidou wants to use his profits to expand his business and to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertiliser, and 20 litres of petrol.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma is 38 years old and married with six children. Five of her children are in school, she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Nelma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 22,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Nelma has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  5 personas   responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE MICAELA BASTIDA ” una  de ellas es  LA SRA. JULIA  de 58   años casada  y con 2  hijos, la Sra. Julia  se dedica ya hace 10  años a la venta de golosinas  en un pequeño mercado  (alquilado)  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante, Sra. Julia  ha logrado mejorar su economía  y mejorar su calidad de vida , y  así Seguir mejorando su negocio  , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más golosinas y seguir con su posterior venta  y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo, Sra. Julia  se le distingue por su casaca de color rojo,  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The group is made up of 5 people who are responsible for different business activities, and they are the members of the community group "MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE MICAELA BASTIDA" [Enterprising Women from Micaela Bastida]. One of the members is Julia, she is 58 years old, married and has two children.

Julia has worked for 10 years selling candies in a small market (rented) every day with the hope of getting ahead. Julia has improved her personal economy and improved her quality of life, and continues to improve her business.

With the loan granted, she will invest it in purchasing more candies and continuing with her previous sales, in order to have more income. She says goodbye with a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo. Julia can be distinguished by her red coat, and she appreciates the loan because it has made her progress possible.

loans.use: to purchase candies.

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es: Jose se dedica desde hace 10 años al cultivo de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside y posee mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos, Jose vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos,  el está solicitando un crédito para la compra semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi continuar con su trabajo para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose has worked for the last 10 years cultivating corn. He commercializes with this products in the surrounding areas of his place of residence. He has a lot of customers due to the good quality of his products.

José lives in his own house along with his wife and three children. He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, products for pest control, weed-killer, etc. so he can continue doing his work and obtain better incomes.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, products for pest control, weed-killer, etc.

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Akpéné jeune femme de 27ans est mariée et mère d'un enfant de 05ans. Afin de contribuer aux besoins familiaux, elle revend des biscuits, des arachides et mèches à domicile et cela depuis 2011.  N'arrivant pas à satisfaire les clients comme elle le souhaite, Akpéné fait son premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Elle espère contribuer aux besoins de la famille et agrandir la taille de l'activité.
texts.en: Akpene is a young woman of 27 who is married with a five-year-old child. To help with the family expenses, she has been selling biscuits, peanuts, and strands of hair from home since 2011. As she cannot satisfy her customers as she would like to, Akpene requests her first loan to buy more merchandise. She hopes to contribute to the family's needs and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy strands of hair, biscuits, and other products.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: To make a living, Lilibeth has been operating a general store in her village. She earns well from this, and supplements her husband's income from working as a mechanic.The business is doing well and she has fully repaid her previous loan used for the business.  Improving her business is her desire for she wants to have a better source of income for the family in the future. She took a new loan recently to purchase more stocks of grocery goods for her store. She thanks GDMPC as her partner in improving the general living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pots, spoons, plates and others for her food stall.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is 50 years old and married. Erminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Erminda has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell charcoal. She successfully paid back her previous loans and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

Erminda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell like soap, chips, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Altanbat

texts.en: Mr. Altanbat, 35 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He runs an automobile repair shop and grows vegetables on his land. Using his previous loan, he bought a tractor for preparing tillage. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT to buy spare parts in large quantity for his automobile repair shop. By doing so, he will run his business without worrying about inventory shortage.

loans.use: to buy  spare parts for his automobile repair shop

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 73 years old and married to a tuba gatherer.  In their village, she owns and operates a retail store selling grocery goods. For many years, she has been able to provide for the needs of her family and has repaid her previous loan. 

She recently took a new loan in order to purchase more grocery goods. Her husband is still gathering tuba and she is buying more tuba from their neighbor to sell. 
 
She hopes to save a portion of her revenue for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith de 44 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija de 21 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, desde hace varios años que Judith se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal como: lociones, cosméticos, shampoo, cremas, desodorantes, etc. vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, posee mucha clientela ya establecida por los buenos precios y la calidad del producto, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su negocio y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Judith, age 44, is a single mother. She lives in a house of her own along with her 21-year-old daughter, who is currently studying. For several years Judith has worked selling products of personal use, like: lotions, cosmetics, shampoo, creams, deodorants, etc. 

She is a street vendor and sells her products in the different neighborhoods near her house. She has a lot of customers due to her good prices and the quality of her products. She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise for her business and improve her incomes.

loans.use: to buy lotions, cosmetics, shampoo, creams, deodorants, etc

loans.name: Hector Felipe

texts.es:
Hector es un joven valiente y soltero de 21 años, trabaja como Agente de Seguridad en su ciudad natal, Chiclayo. Cada mañana despierta con gran motivación porque quiere darle lo mejor a su familia. Hector es consciente que su trabajo es un poco arriesgado, es por ello que quiere empezar a estudiar una carrera a distancia para poder tener otras oportunidades laborales para la tranquilidad de su familia. 
Hector está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una laptop para empezar a estudiar, con esto más adelante podrá conseguir un trabajo más seguro y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Más adelante espera convertirse en un gran profesional para orgullo de su familia.
texts.en:
Hector is a brave single 21 year old. He works as a security guard in his native city, Chiclayo. Each morning he wakes up with a lot of motivation because he wants to provide the best for his family. Hector is conscious that his work is a bit risky. It is for that reason that he wants to begin to study distance learning classes so that he can have other employment opportunities to give his family more peace of mind.

Hector is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to the support they have given him he can buy a laptop to begin to study. In the future he can get a safer job and improve his family's quality of living. He also hopes in the future to become a great professional and be the pride of his family.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his distance learning classes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase books and uniforms for his children.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Elizabeth has been in this business for seven years. Elizabeth earns additional income from food vending.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell. 

Elizabeth dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Amelina

texts.en:
Amelina is 35 years old and married. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Amelina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from E-loading. Amelina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 66 years old and married with three children.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lolita has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transportation.

Lolita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 49 years old and married with six children.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

Marilou successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marilou aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college and save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 43 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of fattening pigs in the Philippines. Elsa requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in the pig fattening business for 10 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 51 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as rice, soft-drinks, soap and other groceries.

Victoria has been in this business for fourteen years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. 

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as rice, soft-drinks, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es: Idalia de 34 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 11 y 6 años y su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se todos los días se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar. Idalia tiene una familia bastante grande por lo que desea construir paredes al patio trasero para formar un cuarto, y lograr así que su familia se encuentre más cómoda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir las paredes para un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en: Idalia is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her two sons, who are 11 and 6, and her family unit. She is an entrepreneurial woman who makes a living as a housekeeper. Idalia has quite a big family, which is why she wants to build walls for the back patio to make it into a room, to allow her family to live more comfortably. She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron, to build the walls to make a room in her home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron, to build a wall to make a room in her home.

loans.name: Los Artesanos Group

texts.es: Julia de  47 años de edad soltera  y  sin  hijos , julia tiene un  pequeño restaurantes  (alquilado)  donde labora todos los días  ya hace un 5 año. Julia ,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir sus gastos personales ,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus  comidas típicas   y  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar (sillas, mesas, menestras, etc. ), Para su posterior venta  y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  julia  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Julia  es la primera de la mano derecha se le distingue por su pantalón turquesa, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Julia is 47 years old, single, and has no children. She has a small restaurant, in a rented space, where she works every day, and has done so for 5 years now. Julia has developed a loyal clientele  which has generated incomes to cover her personal expenses. In the future she would like to have her own location where she can sell her typical dishes and obtain greater incomes.

With the requested loan, she will buy chairs, tables, and other items for her later sales. This way she will continue satisfying the needs of her customers and will be able to get ahead. At this time, Julia and all the group members are grateful to Kiva for the loan they have received and for the confidence that has been placed in them.

Julia is the first one on the right, and can be identified by her turquoise pants. She says goodbye with the promise to meet all of the proposed payments.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and silverware.

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for five years and she earns well from her store. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Berlinda would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With 15,000 PHP, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Berlinda hopes for her business to grow bigger and that her children will complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members where she shares stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is separated from her husband, and she solely provides for her family of five children. She is 58 and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. 

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a food vending business in the bus terminal.

Evelyn has taken a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy additional stock such as snacks, peanuts and soft drinks to sell.  She has been doing this for many years.

Evelyn aspires to build a little shop for her retailing business and to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as snacks, peanuts and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Emelida

texts.en:
Emelida is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Carles, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 14 years now. This is their source of income.

Emelida is asking for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, epoxy and paint. With this, they will be able to complete the construction of their new fishing boat. Their old fishing boat was ruined when a super typhoon hit the country several months ago. 

Emelida believes that this loan could help them improve their fishing business. She hopes to expand their fishing business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, epoxy and paint

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 58 years old and married with seven children.

Conchita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Conchita has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the vegetable business for 11 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Conchita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell for her business.

Amelita has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from tailoring.

Amelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 52 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Andrea runs a general store in the Philippines and she as been in this business for 20 years. She has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, candies, eggs, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

Andrea would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like snack foods, canned goods, candies, eggs, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Buyandelger

texts.en:
Buyandelger is a ceremony officer at a monastery. Using his previous loan, he renovated his house and significantly reduced coal usage. 

Now he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy blocks in order to build a garage. As winter is coming to Mongolia, he needs a garage which can prevent his car from freezing. Constant freezing affects the overall performance of the car and can result in lots of pollutants.

loans.use: to build a garage.

loans.name: Maria Clara

texts.en:
Maria Clara lives in Lanao del Norte  with her children. She has been operating  a general store in order to earn a living and has had this business for over five years. Aside from this, she helps her husband operate their own fishing business. 

With her generated revenue from these businesses, her previous loans used for her grocery store and fishing business were successfully repaid. She provides for her family with her earnings.  She is determined and faithful in doing this for the family.  She took a new loan recently to buy more stocks of grocery goods to sell. She wants to be able to expand her business and continue improving it, as well the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a dried fish vendor from the town of Carles, Iloilo. She is 65 years old, widowed and she has five grown-up children. Elizabeth has been in the dried fish selling for more than 40 years now. This is the source of her income.
Elizabeth needs a loan to gain access to additional capital for her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish for drying. Elizabeth dreams to expand her dried fish selling business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito is 25 years old and is from Maria Aurora, Aurora. He is taking up Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. 

He chose this course because it is easier to have a job with it and he wants to finish his studies to help his family. To make this possible, he wants to seek PHP 15,000 of financial assistance from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: María Leopolidina

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 9 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera. Esta desde el inicio en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a salir adelante en muchos momentos difíciles de su vida.
Doña María es una mujer que siempre le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para así salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda. Trabaja todos los días ya sea en la mañana o tardes de acuerdo a como se les haga mas fácil a sus clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Sus sueños es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The loan group "9 de Octubre" (October 9) meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and craftsmanship, recognized nationally and internationally. It is where famous Panama hats are from. 

This is where María lives. She is 42 years old and a single mother. She has been part of this loan group from the beginning, and she enjoys it because the loans have helped her get through many difficult times in her life. María is a woman who has always worked very hard to get ahead. She makes a living selling different types of clothing door to door, and also from her home when her customers need something. She works every day either in the morning or afternoon, depending on her customers' preferences. She accepts credit payment, which she collects every 15 days. 

María has been working in this industry for over 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise including pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. Her dream is to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia, 50, is a widowed woman with five children. Two children are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emilia has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. 

Emilia requested a 19,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers. In the future, Emilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gasoline, motor oil  and spare parts needed for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita manages her variety store which also has an eatery and rice mill. She also has farming and hog raising businesses. Nenita is a widow and has five grown up children. Though she's living alone, still she is grateful because her children are always there to comfort her through communication. Some of her children are working abroad and are seperated from her. 

At her age, 59, she still has the determination to improve all her businesses and to be involved so that she can secure her future for when she grows weak. With her determination to manage all her businesses, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 which will allow her to buy grocery items, raw meat (pork, chicken) and vegetables to sell.

She believes that someday she will be able to generate greater income and provide quality service to all her customers in her variety store with her eatery and rice mill.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, raw meat (pork, chicken) and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children ages 11, 9 and eight years old. Maricel lives with her family in the town of Carles, Iloilo. Maricel has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 14 years now. This is the source of their income.

Maricel is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this, they will be able to improve their fishing business as well as their income. In the future, Maricel wishes to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora works with determination in order to obtain reliable earnings to cover the needs of her family. She works selling grocery goods and at the same time helps her husband operating their own farm to make a living. 

Farming is the main source of income for the family and she needs financial help in order to improve it. She had a previous loan from Gata Daku MPC  which she used for these activities and it was repaid successfully. 

She took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer. She wants to expand her farm and to have more revenue to improve the living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna owns a retail store wherein she offers various kinds of merchandise. She is now 52 years old and happily married. Her husband's occupation is farming. Both of them aims to have a better way of living and earn a better income.

In connection with their goals, Myrna is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000.She will use this amount to buy grocery items such as sugar, milk, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil and soap to sell. She is expecting that her requested loan amount will be granted.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as sugar, milk, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman and a mother of a two young children from Carles, Iloilo. Irene has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 7 years now. Her husband is a fisherman. 
Irene is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat. With this, her husband will able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.  In the future, Irene hopes to expand their fishing business and makes it a success. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her two children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Leus

texts.en:
Leus has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for seven years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Leus would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 50,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Leus hopes to give her children a better future by providing them good and quality education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build chicken coops and buy animals.

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en:
Mrs. Ayush, 41 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been making dresses for living since 2004. Her husband renders taxi services. 

Using her previous loan, she purchased an electric sewing machine which made her work more efficient. This time, she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and shingles in order to repair the roof of her house and the fences. The repair will make her family's living conditions more comfortable.

loans.use: to repair the roof of the house and the fences.

loans.name: Porcita

texts.en:
Porcita is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She settled for a living in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, with her family. She helps her husband in their fishing business: she sells fish in their community while her husband does the fishing. 

Porcita had fully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She took out a new loan recently to furnish their new fishing boat to be used for their fishing activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to furnish their new fishing boat to be used for their fishing activities.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora works hard to support her family. Flora is widowed and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Flora requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell on her fish stall.

Flora has been in this business for 40 years now.

Flora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell on her fish stall.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and food vending. Helen is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle transport business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in water lines, taps, cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, etc., to install potable water and construct a bathroom with a sink.

loans.name: Balkis

texts.es:
Balkis es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, madre de un niño de 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, amable, alegre, responsable y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000´un lugara caracterizado por el asentamiento de comunidades alejadas campesinas que dieron lugar al creciente comercio en todas las áreas.
Balkis es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua natal es el español. Su trabajo es la cocina, ella se dedica a satisfacer el buen gusto de sus clientes, con recetas de platos típicos del lugar, como;  Arroz con Queso,  Majadito,  Locro de Gallina, Ají de Panza, etc.
Su vida la comparte con su pequeño hijo que todavía no va a la escuela, ella sueña independizarse y tener su propio negocio realizando la compra de un horno y una heladera, para generar mejores ingresos económicos y tener más tiempo para estar con su hijo.
Es por esos motivos que Balkis solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno y una heladera para independizarse y tener más tiempo para su hijo.
texts.en:
Balkis a 28 year old single mother of her 4 year old son, who makes a living selling food. She is a good mother, patient, nice, happy, responsible, and a hard worker. She works in the area "plan 3000," a place known for its settlements of remote communities that led to increased business in the area. 

Balkis is of dark complexion, with long black hair, of medium height. Her native tongue is Spanish. She works as a cook; she is dedicated to making delicious food for her customers, with typical local dishes such as rice with cheese, majadito (a mixture of beef jerky and rice served with a fried egg and a banana), chicken stew, pork belly stew, etc.

She lives with her son who doesn't go to school yet. She dreams of independence, and having her own business. She wants to buy an oven and a refrigerator, to increase her income and have more time to spend with her son. This is why Balkis is requesting a loan to buy an oven and a refrigerator, to work independently and have more time with her son.

loans.use: to buy an oven and a refrigerator, to work independently and have more time with her son.

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en: Bryan is a 21-year-old from Maria Aurora, Aurora. He is taking consumer electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. He wants to finish his studies to find a stable job. His family is struggling financially because he has nine siblings. So, to help him sustain his studies, he wants to avail himself of an education loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Dolys De Jesus

texts.es:
Dolys una mujer de 48 años de edad, ofuscada y algo depresiva por el hecho de estar en su casa y no ser productiva y lo más impactante ver que pasaban necesidades, decidió aventurarse y tomar la iniciativa de montar un negocio propio. 
Para ser concretos Dolys quiere iniciar un servicio de lavandería a domicilio más puntualmente prestar las lavadoras, con este servicio puede ayudar en su hogar, traer ingresos que son indispensables y tan necesarios para tener una adecuada alimentación y un estilo de vida digno. 

Su sueño es tener éxito en su negocio y con el monto solicitado comprara 3 lavadoras que señalaran el comienzo de una ojala futura vida de progreso.
texts.en:
Dolys is 48 year old, not satisfied by being at home and not being productive.  She wants to be able to take care of her daily needs.  Thus, she decided to venture out and take the initiative to start a business.

Dolys wants to start a home laundry service as washing machines provide more timely service.  This business can help in her home, bringing in revenues that are essential to an adequate diet and living with dignity.

His dream is to succeed in her business and the loan requested will buy 3 washing machines.  That will signal the beginning of a future life and hopefully progress.

loans.use: to buy 3 washing machines to start a laundry business because she wants to feel more productive and  know that she can take care of her home needs.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 23 años de edad, el es una joven emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el tiene un hijo de tan solo 4 años de edad y es un  excelentes estudiante de la escuela de su comunidad.
	
El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 10 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y construir casa para tener una condición de vida adecuada y comprar más terrenos para poder ampliar mas las plantaciones de bananos ya que es un buen negocio para tener ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 23 years old. He is a young entrepreneur and determined to be able to rise above; he doesn't let himself be defeated by the obstacles that life puts in front of him but instead reaches all of his goals and dreams. He has a four-year-old son who is an excellent student at the community school.
	
Manuel earns money from the production of bananas in the community where he lives. His parents taught him this work ten years ago. He sells his product in the market and the areas surrounding his community. In this way he has an income to improve his family's living conditions.

He will use the loan for banana maintenance, as it's very important to him that his bananas produce first-rate fruit so he doesn't lose the customers he counts on.

One of his great aspirations is to plant more banana plants. He also wants to build a house to be able to have a better quality of life and to buy more land to be able to expand the banana plantations further, as it is a good business for earning an income.

loans.use: to do banana maintenance

loans.name: Joel Aaron

texts.es: Joel un joven de 19 años de edad. Estudia la carrera de administración bancaria por 01 año y medio. Joel decidió estudiar  dicha carrera  interesado en tener su propio negocio juntamente a sus padres. Actualmente recibe el apoyo de sus padres para cubrir una parte del pago de su mensualidad. Así mismo trabaja como cajero en un supermercado. En esta ocasión solicitó el  crédito para el pago de la mensualidad de sus estudios. El deseo de Joel es de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera, para poder incorporarse al mercado laboral y posteriormente formar su propio negocio. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar dicho crédito ya que le permite su progreso.
texts.en:
Joel is a young man of 19 years old. He has studied the career of bank administration for a year and a half. Joel decided to study this career since he is interested in having his own business along with his parents. Right now he has their support to pay for a part of the monthly fees. He also works as a cashier in a supermarket.
