This time he is requesting a loan to pay the monthly fees of his studies. Joel’s wish is to finish his studies in a successful way, so he can enter the labor market and then establish his own business. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for facilitating this loan, since it allows him to progress.

loans.use: to pay the mothly fees of his studies.

loans.name: Vargas

texts.en: Vargas is a 24-year-old from Maria Aurora, Aurora. He is taking consumer electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. He has eight siblings. The family’s only source of income is farming. They get their income at harvest time, so paying for his tuition fees is a little hard for them. To be able to study, he wants to avail himself of an education loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders. He is hopeful that lenders will approve his loan so he can reach his dreams and help his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Oykhon

texts.ru: Эту жительницу района Шахритус зовут Ойхон. Она 49-летняя замужняя женщина. Ойхон живет с мужем, четырьмя сыновьями, невестками и внуками. Она со своей семьей занимается животноводством. На протяжении 6 лет их семья разводит коров и быков для продажи. Эта деятельность широко развита в их местности, так как природа и климат сами благоприятствуют ведению этого вида деятельности. Ойхон хочет увеличить поголовье скота, так как у нее остались пару коров. Она просит кредит для купли крупнорогатого скота. Ойхон верит и надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This resident of the Shahrituz region is called Oykhon. She is a 49 years old, married woman. Oykhon lives with her husband, four sons, daughters-in-law and grandchildren. She works with livestock breeding together with her family. For a period of 6 years their family has bred cows and bulls for sale. This activity is widespread in their area, as the nature and climate is very favorable for this type of business. 

Oykhon would like to increase the number of cattle, as she only has two cows left. She requests a loan to purchase cattle. Oykhon trusts in and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for increasing the number of livestock

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía Comunal “Las Esmeraldas” y  la conforman  07 socias trabajadoras y responsables. Mirell de 37 años de edad, es  separada con 03 hijos dependientes. Hace más de 04 años que se dedica a la venta de bebidas. Como actividad secundaria distribuye empaque de plátanos para tamales. Su mayor deseo es contar con su local propio para poder aumentar el volumen de sus productos. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de agua de meza, gaseosa, frugos y bebidas enlatadas.  El grupo “Las Esmeraldas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el crédito brindado. Mirell se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste casaca celeste.
texts.en:
This is the “Las Esmeraldas” communal loan group and it has seven hardworking and responsible members. 

Mirell is 37 years old and is separated with three children in her care. She has been selling drinks for more than four years. As a secondary business she distributes plantain wrappers for tamales. Her greatest desire is to have her own place so she can increase the volume of her products. She will use her latest loan to buy bottled water, soft drinks, Frugos juices and canned drinks.

The “Las Esmeraldas” group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan provided. Mirell is standing in the back; she is the second woman from the left and is wearing a light blue jacket.

loans.use: to buy bottled water, soft drinks, Frugos juices and canned drinks.

loans.name: Janette

texts.es:
Janette es una mujer de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 4 años, y su negocio es la confección de tejidos para niños.
Ella es emprendedora, fuerte, luchadora, independiente, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en el ‘cruce villa Adela’ un lugar de crecimiento constante y abundante comercio en todas las áreas.
Janette es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, viste a la moda, su lengua natal es el aymara el cual ya no utiliza y habla español para todas sus necesidades de comercio y diarias. Su negocio es la confección de tejidos para niños, como; chompas, pantalones, gorros, etc. Sus comienzos fueron como ayudante de costura en el taller de su cuñada, luego fue comprando máquinas hasta independizarse y tener su negocio propio. Su vida la comparte con su pareja y sus dos hijos, viven muy apretados en la casa de sus suegros, porque también vive ahí la familia de su cuñada.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y llegar a más clientes para generar mejores ingresos económicos y alquilar una vivienda donde sus hijos puedan jugar.
Es por esos motivos que Janette solicita un préstamo para ampliar su taller de tejido y con los beneficios ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Janette is a 26 years old and lives with her partner.  She has two children aged 6 and 4 years.  Her business is the manufacture of clothing for children.
She is enterprising, strong, feisty, independent, a good mother, responsible and hardworking. She is located at the Adela Intersection, a ​​place of constant heavy trade and growth in all areas.

Janette is of dark complexion, medium build, long black hair, and a sense of style.  Her native language is Aymara which is no longer used and speaks Spanish for all her trading and daily needs. Her business is the production of clothing for children, including; sweaters, pants, hats, etc. Her beginnings were as an assistant in the sewing workshop of her sister.  Subsequently, she began buying machines to be independent and have her own business.  She shares her life with a partner and their two children.  They live in the house of her in-laws which is very cramped because the the sister's family lives there as well.

Her dream is to expand her business and reach more customers.  Thus with by generating better income she will be able to rent a home where her children can play.  It is for these reasons that Janette is applying for a loan to expand her clothing workshop and with the profits to help her family.

loans.use: to expand her clothing workshop and with the profits to help her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for four years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide her children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Ludy would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 25,000, she can purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance, in advance.

In the future, Ludy hopes to maintain an increasing profit, grow her business and manage a bigger storehouse.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Virgita

texts.en:
Virgita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell for her business.

Virgita has been in this business for 4 years. Virgita earns additional income a from general store.

Virgita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Raquel works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Raquel is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal retailing business.

Raquel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.ru: Разия, 62 года, вдова, мать 4 детей. С2004 года занимается торговлей продуктами питания, в торговле помогает сын. Магазин Разии находится на территории дома. Образование у Разии средне-специальное, она очень трудолюбивая и ответственная. Продукция магазина пользуется большим спросом и приносит ежемесячную прибыль в среднем 35,000 сом (KGS). Разия обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров в магазине. Увеличив товарооборот, Разия сможет расширить свой магазин, получать больше прибыли и накопить средства на образование ее внуков.
texts.en:
Razia is 62 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children. Since 2004 she has worked with sale of food products. Her son helps her with the business. Razia's store is on the grounds of her home. Razia has seconday vocational education. She is very hardworking and responsible.

The products in her store are in high demand and bring a monthly income of 35,000 som (KGS) on average. Razia turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan of the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to expand the assortment of goods in her store. After increasing the turnover, Razia will be able to expand her store, get a higher income and save money for the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy products to increase the assortment in her shop and be more competitive

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
Abelardo es un señor de 62 años de edad, es empleado, no estudió por los problemas económicos en que vivían sus padres, esta acompañado y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ya no viven con él porque formaron su propio hogar, con Abelardo vive su compañera de vida y un nieto.

Su compañera de vida no trabaja, pero tiene una pensión la cual le depositan mensualmente, mientras que Abelardo se dedica a la vigilancia en una ferretería desde hace varios años, trabajo que lo aprendió por la misma necesidad en que vivían con sus familiares, para trasladarse a su lugar de trabajo Abelardo viaja en motocicleta 4 kilómetros, trabajando 24 horas en días de por medio.

El préstamo que Abelardo esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar materiales para construcción como lamina y tubos para construir un corredor, ya que la casita no lo tiene y se mojan cuando llueve.

Los sueños de Abelardo son ver a su nieto sano, fuerte y estudiado para que en un futuro sea una persona de bien y tenga más posibilidades para trabajar y comprar un vehículo para trasladarse con más seguridad hacia su trabajo.
texts.en:
Abelardo is a 62-year-old gentleman. He is employed, and he did not attend university because of his parents' economic difficulties. He has a live-in partner and 3 children, who no longer live with him because they have formed their own households. Abelardo lives with his life partner and one grandson. 

His life partner does not work, but she has a pension which is deposited for her monthly. Meanwhile, Abelardo has worked for several years as a security guard in a hardware store. He learned this work because of the same need that he experienced with his family members. To reach his workplace, Abelardo travels 4 kilometers on a motorcycle. He works for 24 hours every other day. 

The loan that Abelardo is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy construction materials such as metal sheets and bars to build a covered corridor, since his small house does not have one and they get wet when it rains. 

Abelardo's dreams are to see his grandson healthy, strong and attending university, so that he can be a successful person in the future with more work opportunities; and also to buy a vehicle so he can get to work more safely.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and bars to build a covered corridor in his home.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married. She has two children. Tatyana has her own business; she sells groceries in the central market. She has 18 years of work experience. The best-selling products are cheese, butter, margarine and sausages. Tatyana is persevering and hardworking. Tatyana and her husband work a lot in order to provide their family with the necessities of life.

Tatyana has already used Kiva for loans and considers it very convenient and useful for her business. Thanks to Kiva loans, Tatyana was able to acquire a trading post and equipment, which has had a positive impact on the development of her business. This time, Tatyana is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to expand her assortment of goods.

loans.use: to increase product variety at her food stall.

loans.name: Yesenia Abigail

texts.es: Yesenia de 29 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sostener la economía familiar apoyada en su negocio de venta de chocolate, el cual ella misma elabora comprando cacao, azúcar y canela luego ella lo pone a tostar, lo lleva al molino y lo moldea para venderlo como tableta. Yesenia siempre anda buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos y es por ello que anteriormente solicito un crédito a FUSAI el cual invirtió en su pequeño negocio y es gracias a ello que actualmente surte pedidos, ella se siente agradecida con el apoyo brindado, por lo que desea solicitar un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cacao, azúcar y canela para seguir expandiendo su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 29 years old and lives in a house she owns with her life partner and their 5-year-old son. Thanks to her effort and tenacity, she has been able to support her family with her business selling homemade chocolate, buying cacao, sugar, and cinnamon and then roasting them. She takes this to the mill and molds it to sell it as a chocolate bar.

Yesenia is always looking for a way to improve her earnings and that is why she asked FUSAI for an earlier loan that she invested in her small business. Thanks to this she is currently taking requests. She feels grateful for the support provided and wants to ask FUSAI for a new loan to invest in cacao, sugar and cinnamon to keep expanding her small business.

loans.use: to buy cacao, sugar and cinnamon to keep expanding her small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, oils, canned goods, snack foods, seasonings and beverages to resell

loans.name: Drechele Joy

texts.en:
Drechele Joy is 18 years old and is from Maria Aurora, Aurora. She is taking up Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. She chose this course because it is in demand. 

Her father is a construction worker while her mother owns a sari sari store. Though both of them are earning, sometimes it is not enough for the schooling of their children. 

Drechele wants to finish her studies to help her parents and also for her personal success. To help her achieve this, she wants to take an educational loan of PHP 15,000 from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 35 years old and married. She is blessed with two children, and they live happily in a rural community. Due to hardships of living, she is engaged in buying and reselling footwear at the public market while she takes care of her youngest child. She aims to further improve her business and generate sufficient income to meet their daily necessities. She wants to acquire more stock of footwear to sell, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy more stock of shoes, sandals, slippers, bags and foot socks to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help to her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, sandals, slippers, bags and foot socks to resell

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a 57-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 30 years now. Fishing is their main source of living. 

Leonor is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. Through this, Leonor and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Leonor hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Onelyn

texts.en:
Onelyn is a 41-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband, and this is the source of their income.

Onelyn is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine. With this, they will  be able to go back to fishing and improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new boat engine

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza has settled for a living in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur with her family. She is a 35-year-old hardworking and enthusiastic woman with a strong self-improvement drive. She has been unable to send her children to school because she only earns enough for their daily needs. But, she never stops working on it with the help of her husband. 

Flordeliza successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business, and she saves little by little a portion of her revenue. She took a new loan recently in order to buy additional stock to sell in her grocery store. She is hopeful to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Hello! 

Benson, from Kapsumai (a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya), is an active and progressive farmer in his locality. He has a wife and four children, and together they live on a small piece of land. Traditionally, his primary source of income has been eggs, crops and a personal business. He has been practicing farming for the past 15 years. Having been farming for such a long time, he has gained much experience and he is always ranked the best farmer in his village. 

Demand for dairy milk has been high and Benson wants to take advantage of the market; therefore, he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya, and Benson has already identified the breed of dairy cow that he wants. Benson always says that “to become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers.” He has planted so many trees on his farm that dairy food will never be a problem. Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge because he will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. Through the loan he will not only benefit from milk but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used to improve the fertility of his farm, saving money that would have been spent in buying fertilizer. 

Benson has been facing challenges in accessing finances but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make his dream come true. Benson chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. Benson underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training season, he learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Through accumulated profits, he plans to permanently improve his living conditions and secure the future of his school-age children by paying tuition fees for them. He thinks that with increased income he will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester and, hence, save costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos de 40 años de edad, es jornalero, su nivel de estudió fue hasta el séptimo grado, no continuo estudiando porque sus padres ya no pudieron por la economía en que vivían, Carlos se acompaño y tuvieron junto con su compañera de vida 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 10 años de edad, ahora en día Carlos y su compañera de vida se separaron y solo se quedo con un hijo (el menor) que se encuentra estudiando el tercer grado y su ex compañera de vida se quedo con los otros dos hijos. 

Carlos se dedica a la corta de caña y a la siembra de 7000 metros cuadrado de maíz desde hace varios años, trabajo que lo aprendió por la misma necesidad en que vivían y por ayudar a sus padres en los ingresos, para llegar a su trabajo Carlos camina un kilometro todos los días.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una novilla para repasto, donde espera tener un poco mas de ingresos y así podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

El sueño de Carlos es que su hijo estudie mucho para que en un futuro sea una persona de bien y comprar una motocicleta para trasladarse a su trabajo y a cualquier lugar.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is 40 years old, is a day laborer. He went to school through seventh grade. He couldn't continue studying because his parents were not able [to send him] because of the economy in which they lived. Carlos married, and together with his life companion they had three children, ages 19, 17, and 10. Carlos and his life companion are now separated, and he is left with one son, the youngest, who is in third grade. His former companion remains with the other two children.

Carlos has been working for a number of years in cutting sugar cane and in raising 7000 square meters of corn, work that he learned out of the same necessity in which they lived and to help his parents with income. To arrive at his work, Carlos walks a kilometer every day.

The loan that he is applying for from CrediCampo is to buy a heifer to pasture, from which he hopes to have a little more income and thus be able to give a better quality of life to his family.

Carlos' dreams are that his son studies hard so that in the future he can be a good person and to buy a motorcycle so that he can go to his work and to any other place.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to pasture

loans.name: Amsterdam Group

texts.en:
Lilian is age midsixties, married, and has been blessed with four births: two sons and two daughters. One of her daughters died and left two kids, who are still young. Lilian takes care of her five grandkids (including two from her dead daughter), who are still in school. She always makes sure her grands get all their basic needs covered as much as she can, with assistance from her husband, so as to feel that they are at home. She is an encouraging grandmother, who always likes to see her grands happy and performing well. 

Lilian has been a businesswoman running a poultry farm: a business she has been with since 1974. During this time, it has been too difficult to find chicks or someone to manage an incubator, so it was too hard to raise chicks. Despite the difficulties, Lilian has still stayed with her poultry business up to this moment. Currently, she raises up to 300 layers, and she is able to collect seven trays of eggs per day. She wants to buy an extra 200 layers. She is also raising 400 to 800 broilers per batch. She works from 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. every working day and is able to realize a fair monthly income.

This is Lilian's 18th credit cycle from Tujijenge Tanzania; she has paid back all of the previous loans successfully. Lilian used the previous credit to increase her number of chicks: layers from 200 to 300 and broilers from 400 to 800 current. She also used it to buy chicken feeds and vaccinations. With a good job, she has earned extra income, which she has used to pay school fees and part of home food expenses. She is so thankful for Kiva's support and believes it will keep on supporting her family and business. 

Lilian will use her 18th cycle to buy 200 layers for her poultry business. Lilian will share this loan with her loan group, "Amsterdam", which consists of two members, who will be accountable to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy 200 layers for her poultry business.

loans.name: Reina Albetya

texts.es:
Reina, es casada, vive en casa de un familiar junto a su esposo; siendo soltera hizo la apertura de una sorbetería, como una forma de tener independencia económica, aún la conserva para obtener mejores ingresos, actualmente María es empleada como gerente de una casa comercial y cuando ella lo atendía por ser mujer era víctima de extorsión por lo que tomo la decisión de encargarle a su tío el negocio para que se lo atienda y lo cuide.
Invertirá el capital en la compra de un congelador, así conservara el sorbete en óptimas condiciones para ofrecer a sus clientes productos de calidad, equipara su negocio para mantenerlo funcionando y generando ingresos para cumplir con sus diferentes compromisos. 
Sus sueños son mejorar su situación económica para que cuando decida tener hijos pueda cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Reina is married and lives in a relative's house with her husband. When she was single, she opened a sorbet shop to be financially independent. She still has the business to earn a better income. She is currently employed as the manager of a trading house. When she was looking after the business, she was a victim of extortion due to being a woman. Therefore, she decided to put her uncle in charge of the business so he could take care of it.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of a freezer. She will then keep her sorbet in excellent conditions to offer her clients a good-quality product. She will equip her business to keep it running and generate earnings to comply with her various obligations.

Her dream is to improve her financial situation so that she will be able to cover her needs when she decides to have children.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to keep her sorbet in excellent condition and offer her clients a good-quality product.

loans.name: Tanzania Group

texts.en:
Isihaka, who is in his early 40s is married with three sons who are still at school.  He has been running a general store for five years now.  He works from 7am to 11pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Isihaka's 23rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his store's stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is doing great with his loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the profit to pay school fees, started building his own house and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase the general store stock. He dreams of finishing building his house.

Isihaka will share this loan with his loan group "Tanzania" which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his general store stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock for her new branch.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Lorna supports her husband in planting and harvesting vegetables and root crops for sale. She is 47 years old and blessed with five children. 

They aim to improve their farming business and generate sufficient income to sustain the necessities of her family and give their children a better living. To expand their vegetable plantation, Lorna wants to take a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production. 

Having patience and strong determination, they believe that someday they will improve their farming business as well as their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Yegli Susana

texts.es:
Yegli es una jovencita de 26 años de edad, es ama de casa, su nivel de estudió fue hasta el sexto grado, no continuo sus estudios por la economía y por la necesidad que tenia su familia se dedico mejor a trabajar para ayudar en los gastos, esta acompañada y es madre de 2 hijos de 5 y 8 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando.

Su compañero de vida se dedica a la corta de caña, mientras que Yegli se dedica a la atención de una pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa desde hace 4 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su madre quien siempre se dedico a este negocio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para surtir mas su tiendita comprando mercadería como churros, dulces, frijoles, arroz, jabón, lejía, etc. así podrá ofrecer mas productos y variedad a los clientes por lo que ellos se sentirán mucho mas satisfechos. Así podrá obtener un poco mas de ganancias para la alimentación de su familia.

El sueño de Yegli es que sus hijos estudien y sean unos profesionales, también sueña con tener una tienda ya mas grande y mucho mas surtida para tratar de cubrir todas las necesidades de los clientes en toda la zona.
texts.en:
Yegli is a 26 year-old young woman, and is a housewife.  She studied until the sixth grade, and did not continue her studies for financial reasons.  Because of her family's needs she started to work more in order to help with their expenses.  She is in a relationship and is the mother of two children, 5 and 8 years old, who are both in school.

Her partner works cutting sugar cane, while Yegli works tending to a small store that she has in her home, that she started 4 years ago.  She learned this work from her mother who had always worked in this type of business.  

The loan she is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to better stock her small store.  She will be purchasing merchandise such as chips, candy, beans, rice, soap, and bleach, as well as other products.  With this she will be able to offer more products and variety to her customers so that they feel more satisfied.  With the loan, she will be able to bring in a little more of an income to feed her family.

Yegli's dream is for her children to study and become professionals.  She also dreams of having a larger store with much more stock, in order to try to cover all of the customers' needs in her area.

loans.use: To buy chips, candy, beans, rice, soap, and bleach, as well as other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en: Leny is 45, married and blessed with one child. For the last 21 years, she has earned a living by owning and operating a retail store in her village where she makes a net income of PHP 800 daily. She uses the income to buy items she needs every day at home. Due to insufficient funds for her business, she is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy more items to sell, including rice, charcoal, canned goods, beverages, noodles, chips, and bread. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa is married and the mother of two children, who are 10 years and 9 months old. For more than six years, she has earned a living by running a store where she sells many items, including food and household utensils. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell, such as slippers, basins, and groceries, including canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, and cooking oil. This loan will allow Nerissa to expand her store and generate more revenue. Her goal is to save enough money to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Marlo

texts.en:
Marlo, from Maria Aurora, is taking up Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. He wants to finish his studies to find a stable job and be able to help his family.

His family does not have sufficient money to send him to school so they want to avail an educational loan of PHP 15,000 from the KIVA lenders to sustain his schooling.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 52 year-old married woman and a mother of two children ages 12 and 9. She earns a living through her fishing business. Alma has been in the fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now.

As of this time, she needs a loan for her business. Alma has requested a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of her fishing boat. Through this, they will be able to improve their fishing business and augment their income.

Alma is very optimistic that through this loans her dreams of expanding her business will come true. She is also saving some money to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena, a tricycle owner, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is 37, married, and mother to two children. Their first child is in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs and to support their children’s schooling.

Azucena owns a tricycle and she also works as a sales lady. Her husband drives the tricycle that carries up to four to six passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Palawan, tricycle is the most common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The townpeople usually ride a tricycle from their homes to the market, to church, to their friend’s homes, and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. They earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan which she will use to buy steel, paint, flat sheet, tires, and pay for the repair labor of her tricycle. It is important that her tricycle is always in good running condition to ensure its continuous service. Their income from their service is a good source to support their daily needs and for the schooling of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.



Azucena hopes to maintain her business. She dreams to send her children to the best school in College. She wants to always lead a happy and quiet life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.



* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her tricycle.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is taking up Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. Because of poverty, his parents can’t support his schooling. So to help himself, Anthony wants to get an educational loan of P15,000 from the KIVA lenders which he will use to sustain his studies. He wants to finish his studies to find a stable job and help his parents out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee.

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.en: Baltazar is 19 years old and lives in Maria Aurora, Aurora. He is taking up Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. He wants to finish his studies to help his family and so he has something to be proud of.  They are struggling financially, so he wants to ask for P15,000 financial assistance from the KIVA lenders to help him go to school.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is 22 year-old young woman from Batumi city. She has a husband and a kindergarten-aged son. Her husband is temporarily unemployed.

The family didn't have any source of income and lived under poverty until Teona started a clothing sales business. She hired a place in the local market, purchased a small stock of clothing ,and start selling. Now she needs financial support for purchasing additional stock and to have money for working capital. Her business is profitable, but it needs investment to continue running well.

Teona requested a loan from Credo and her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program provides startup credit with soft conditions for the country's poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothing and personal items and to expand her business.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José tiene 21 años de edad, es un joven trabajador logro estudiar hasta bachillerato, por falta de recursos economicos no pudo continuar sus estudios universitarios tubo que dedicarse al oficio de panadero, actualmente José vive con dos hermanos.

José se dedica a elaborar pan dulce artesanal como marquesote, quesadillas, pastelitos rellenos de leche, etc oficio que realiza desde hace 4 años, tambien trabaja en la agricultura cultivando granos basicos junto a sus hemanos.

El crédito lo necesita para la compra de insumos agricolas (fertilizantes, semilla y productos fitosanitarios) para cultivar una hectarea de frijol.

El sueño de José es poder continuar con sus estudios, para ello sabe que tiene que trabajar con mucho esfuerzo y ahorrar hasta tener suficiente para costearse sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jose is 21 years old. He is a hardworking young man, who was able to study through high school. Due to a lack of economic resources, he was not able to continue his studies at the university level. Instead, he has had to work as a baker. Jose currently lives with two brothers.

Jose makes a living baking artisan sweet breads such as marquesote (a type of cake bread), quesadillas, pastries filled with milk, etc. He has been doing this work for the past 4 years. He also works in agriculture, cultivating basic grains with his brothers.

He needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, and phytosanitary products to cultivate an hectare of beans.

Jose's dream is to be able to continue his studies. He knows that he must work with great effort and save until he has enough to afford his studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and phytosanitary products to cultivate an hectare of beans.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Reuben, 25 years old, who is a native of the village of Kongyalil in the Kapsowar area of Kenya where he lives with his parents.  His upbringing was challenging and he never went to college so that he could secure a formal job, but he did not surrender to that and has been practicing farming for the past three years. 

Through farming, he has been able to take care of his family. His main source of income has been milk, eggs and crop farming, and through these ventures, he has supported his family because he is the only breadwinner. Reuben passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of his animals “Brown,” which is an English word depicting the color of the cow. 

Reuben stated that the most enjoyable bit about farming is “it gives me personal fulfillment and feeds my family." Although he has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious man. He has been facing challenges transporting his produce from the farm to the market. That is why he is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. 

The Kapsowar area is a rural town and roads are very poor and transporting goods for Reuben has always been a “nightmare”. He has been suffering losses because goods reach the market when they are not fresh, hence fetching a low price. Vegetables and milk are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, and through the loan, he will be able to achieve his dream. 

He plans to employ someone who will be helping him in farm work and transporting the produce to the market, hence impacting the society positively through creation of employment. Increased profits from the loan will allow him to repay the loan fully and be able to permanently change his living conditions and assure his aging parents of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 28 years old, married and the father of four children. His oldest child is seven years old and the youngest is four, and the family lives in its own house in Haja city, Yemen. Ali received an elementary education, then two years ago went into the business of building houses. His family lives in a small, older house. Ali would like to expand his home to make it more spacious, and has added two rooms but has not yet installed a roof. That will cost a lot of money, which is why he he has applied for a Youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB In buy the materials he needs.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Chiesa

texts.en:
Chiesa is a 37 year old married woman and a mother of five children from Carles, Iloilo. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Chiesa has been in the business for more than 10 years now. 

Chiesa is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, soda, noodles, soap, toiletries, cooking oil, salt, vinegar, biscuits and snack foods. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks which attracts more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Chiesa dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, soda, noodles, soap, toiletries, cooking oil, salt, vinegar, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia, age 64, is from Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married with 4 children.  Lilia joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Co-op. The Co-op supported her by providing the capital to start her snack vending business. Helping the family survive, she gives her best ability to make delicious food snacks to sell.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for snack vending

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 45 years old, is married and lives at Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter and the wage that he earns from carpentry work is not enough to meet their needs. Through her desire to earn an income on her own, Mercedita takes in and raises pigs in their backyard. She's been doing this for five years. 

In 2012, Mercedita became an active member of PMPC and she enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. Through PMPC she has obtained the capital to purchase piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional bags of feed. 

Mercedita really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage, so that she can easily keep more sanitary conditions, and to own a small meat shop in the public market.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is thankful for the financial assistance previously extended to her as she was able to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Bernadette wants her business to continue to operate and she dreams for her children to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week where she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana lives at Bato, Plaridel, Philippines. She is 60 years old and chooses to be single. She engages in farming activities through her small coco and rice plots, from which she earns a living. Last year she became a member of PMPC and she actively participates in the various activities offered by the co-op. 

Now Ana wants to obtain financial assistance from PMPC amounting to 4,000 PHP to purchase bags of fertilizers, as she starts to increase her banana production. Someday, Ana wishes to be of help not only to her siblings' children but to the needy as well. She will be happy seeing the people she helps.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various kinds of vegetables and fruits for his store in order to be able to meet all the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Hello, Lenders! Meet Benjamin, who is 39 years of age, a hard worker and a very honest farmer. He hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that has good rainfall patterns and is known for mango farming. Benjamin has one child whom he adores and cherishes, and a beautiful wife who always paints a smile on Benjamin’s face. 

Benjamin has been practicing mixed farming for the past six years and is making great strides. He has been able to earn a decent and honest living through milk and egg selling and personal business. These ventures have enabled him to send his child to school and feed his family. Benjamin has planted many trees on his compound and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed his dairy cow, thereby enhancing his milk-selling profits. 

Because of increased demand, Benjamin is kindly requesting a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture, and he wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. Through the loan, Benjamin is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. 

Through increased profits, Benjamin is sure that he will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of his family. Benjamin, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that he can achieve his dream of owning his own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. 

Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Benjamin save more effectively, and through his accumulated profits, he plans to add value to his milk through packaging. He also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yoghurt and cream.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria is from Taguilon Dapitan City in Zamboanga del Norte. She is 66 years old, married and the mother of three children. In 2011, she applied for membership in PMPC after hearing about all the benefits. She is a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner. Recently, Hilaria requested a loan for Php14,900 to buy ingredients to make food to sell. Her goal is to earn more income and expand her business. She has found financial help through Paglaum MPC and is very thankful for the support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Reynalyn

texts.en: Reynalyn is 37 years old, married, and has four children. One of them is still studying. Reynalyn is involved in the basket-weaving business. She wants to improve their output and that is why she is now asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy bamboo to use in weaving baskets to sell. This will help improve capacity of sales in her business. She hopes to improve their income and continue to support the family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to use in weaving baskets to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 48 years old, married, and lives at Solana with her family. Her spouse is a fisherman. They have three children. Two of them are still studying and in need of allowances. So, Divina involved herself in weaving baskets for extra income. She sells her products at the market. She is now asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy bamboo for use in weaving baskets. She hopes to produce more baskets and other woven items to sell. Additional revenue will be used for education purposes. She will be happy to see her children be professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to use in weaving baskets

loans.name: Annai Shg - Mathur Group

texts.en:
Akila is the leader of the Annai Shg (Self-Help group), which is managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT). The group contains ten other members from the Mathur village in Tamil Nadu. She is 35 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer by profession. They are the parents of two children.    

The group has been receiving loans from PAT for the last three years. These loans have been instrumental in developing the quality of their livelihood as well as in purchasing cows, goats, etc. Because of these loans, they have been able to earn more income; they are prompt in their repayments.

With a Kiva group loan, the members of the group can buy smokeless stoves that lower firewood consumption. As a result, these stoves reduce carbon emissions as well as indoor air pollution levels. By purchasing this stove, group members can reduce fuel consumption, lower costs, and help create a better environment in their surrounding village.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
30 años en el mercado son los que lleva Carlos vendiendo su mercancía en ropa para la familia, actividad que aprendió de su padre quien fundo el negocio, pero ahora los tiempos han cambiado y cada vez hay más competencia y a pesar de todo el tiempo que lleva operando en el mercado sabe que para lograr una venta tiene que tener inventario actualizado y seguir las tendencias de moda. 
 Carlos es padre de 3 hijos ya todos ellos mayores de edad y aspira que uno de ellos se quede con el negocio familiar siguiendo la tradición y haciendo que el negocio no solo prevalezca con el pasar del tiempo si no que se consolide y sea más grande. 

Por ahora es trabajo del señor Carlos llevar su negocio a otro nivel y necesita capital para comprar mercancía por tal razón quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar ropa para toda la familia, buscando mejores ventas y mayor variedad de clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos has been in the business for 30 years, selling his merchandise of clothing for the whole family. He learned this work from his father, who established the business. Since then times have changed, and now there is more competition. Despite all of the time that he has been in this business, he knows that in order to acquire sales he must have an updated inventory and follow fashion trends.

Carlos is the father of 3 children, who are now all adults. He hopes that one of them will take over the family business, continuing the tradition and making sure that the business not only prevails through the passage of time, but also strengthens and grows.

For now, it is Carlos's job to move his business to the next level. He needs money to buy merchandise. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy clothing for the whole family in order to increase his sales and attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing for the whole family in order to attract new customers and update his store according to fashion trends.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, tiene como actividad económica la compra y venta de ganado, es casado, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, no recibe ayuda económica del extranjero, por esfuerzos propios ha salido a delante con su familia y su negocio, José tiene vacas de las cuales vende las crías, para mejorar la raza actualmente le prestan un toro para que pueda aumentar su ganado y mejorar los ingresos.
Le será de ayuda para comprar un toro, así fortalecerá su negocio, dejara de buscar uno prestado y el comercio de ganado le dejara mejores ganancias, con las que  mejorara las circunstancias familiares y cancelará la deuda.
Sus sueños son tener una ganadería más grande y mejor establecida.
texts.en:
José works in the purchase and sale of livestock.  He is married and lives with his spouse and children.  He does not receive any outside financial assistance; through his own efforts he has gotten his family and business ahead.

José has cows, from which he sells the calves.  He currently borrows a bull in order to improve the stock and have more livestock, increasing his income.  It will be helpful for him to buy a bull, so he can strengthen his business and not have to look for a bull to borrow anymore.  The livestock business will then give him a greater income, with which he will better his family's circumstances and pay back the loan.  

His dreams are to have a larger and better established livestock farm.

loans.use: to buy a bull to strengthen his livestock business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna lives at Solana with her family. She is 45 years old, a widow, and has four children. She is a food vendor selling processed meat products such as longganisa (cured pork), tocino (bacon), and hotdogs. She also sells vegetables and offers laundry services for additional income. Now Edna is requesting additional capital of P7,000 to buy more hotdogs, cured pork and bacon to sell. She hopes to keep offering her products in the friendliest way to attract more customers and gain good profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy more hotdogs, cured pork and bacon to sell

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is  a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Iloilo, Philippines. She works hard to support her husband in their fishing business. For more than 15 years, fishing has given them income to support their daily needs and for the schooling of their children. Now, Mely wants to borrow a loan worth 15,000 PHP from CEVI, a micro finance partner of Kiva in the Philippines, to buy new fishing nets and a new boat engine. 

Mely believes that this loan could help them improve their income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and a new boat engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for their jeepney.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity, 32 years old, lives in Poblacion, Municipality of Plaridel, the Philippines. She is married and the mother of three children. Her husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn and other agricultural commodities. Charity has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family, but helps her husband plow the rice field, plant corn and grow other varieties of agricultural commodities. Now she has decided to enhance her children's future by producing rubber. 

To secure working capital, Merlida applied for membership in the Paglaum Cooperative in 2012. She has received several loans already and is requesting a new one for PHP 14,000 to pay labor costs for this project. Charity has been able to generate income and provide for the daily needs of her family. She is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to secure the additional working capita she needsl. She hopes to own a tractor someday.

loans.use: to hire workers on her rubber plantation.

loans.name: Jasmine Shg-Mathur Group

texts.en:
Joysiruby is the leader of the Jasmine Shg (Self Help Group), which is managed by the local NGO, People’s Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Mathur village, Tamil Nadu.

Joysiruby and her family live in their own house. She has two children, and her husband is a farmer. The husband and wife both are very hardworking.

Now Joysiruby wants to purchase a smokeless stove, which will save her time and money. The smokeless stove prevents the risk of getting respiratory diseases from the smoke emitted. Joysiruby and the other members of the group are requesting a loan for a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: tp pay for the paperwork to obtain his degree in Civil Engineering.

loans.name: Pricela

texts.en:
Pricela is 52 years old with five children.  Pricela personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since she joined Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost three years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 10,000 for the purchase of new nets.  

As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  Pricela already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish at the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 54, is married with three adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 21 years already. The business has helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. 

Ana is continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She has taken out loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is from Taguilon, Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 47 years old and is married with three kids. In 2010 Justina applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of member in good standing and repays in a timely manner. 

Recently, Justina has asked for financial assistance in the amount of 40,000 PHP to purchase Avon items for Avon dealing. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and help the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through PMPC and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of Avon items to resell

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe is 42 years old, is married and has four school-aged children. She lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel, Mindanao, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter but had no permanent work until she decided to start a new business. Febe and her husband engage in a furniture-making business, since her husband has the needed carpentry skills. Starting with capital of 3,000 PHP, Febe earned an income from her first sale; seeing the good opportunity, she rolled up their capital to increase her resources. 

Febe has been a member of PMPC for four years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the cooperative offers. Now, she is applying for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more raw materials for her furniture-making business. Through this, she hopes to earn more income and help the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through PMPC and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 33ans, Adjoa célibataire a 02 enfants en charge de 8 et 4ans. Seul l'ainé est scolarisé. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et a ouvert son atelier dans lequel elle exerce sa fonction. En plus de son activité, elle revend des mèches et produits de beauté c'est pour cela, elle fait son premier crédit pour acheter des mèches et des produits de beauté. A l'avenir, Adjoa espère agrandir l'activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Elle se fait aidée par 01 personne et a démarré en 2006.
texts.en: A young woman of 33, Adjoa is single and is raising two children aged 8 and 4 years old.  Only the older child is enrolled in school. Adjoa is a trained hairdresser and has opened her own beauty shop where she works. Besides being a hairdresser, she also resells hair extensions and cosmetics. It is for that reason that she is requesting her first loan to buy extensions and cosmetics. In future, Adjoa hopes to expand her business and improve living conditions for her family. She has one person helping her and opened her salon in 2006.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have working capital to deal with losses in his wood-selling business and to look after his 5 children.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмира, 43 года, замужем, мать 2 детей школьного возраста. У Эльмиры среднее образование, на протяжении 18 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В настоящее время в хозяйстве Эльмиры есть 4 дойные коровы, 5 овец. Также 1,60 ГА земельной доли, на которой Эльмира выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет, применяя только натуральные удобрения и ручной труд. Полученный урожай она реализует оптовым и розничным покупателям. Также Эльмира в больших объемах реализует молоко, экологически чистое и вкусное, оно пользуется большим спросом. В целях дальнейшего развития своей экологичной деятельности, Эльмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистой дойной коровы с теленком, на оставшиеся средства она приобретет дополнительно сено для скота, так как всю зиму скот будет содержаться в сараях и его нужно кормить. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Elmira is 43, married, and the mother of two school-aged children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and has been a crop and livestock farmer for the past 18 years.  Her farm currently has four dairy cows, five sheep, and a 1.60-hectare plot of land where she grows potatoes, grain, and sainfoin using only natural fertilizers and manual labor.  She sells her harvest both to wholesalers and retailers, as well as flavorful organic milk, which is one of her more popular products.  To further develop her organic milk business, Elmira is seeking a loan of 100,000 som from Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy a well-bred dairy cow, a calf, and some extra hay for her livestock with the money left over as she'll be keeping her animals in barns for the winter and will need to feed them.  She plans on using any extra profits due to the loan to further expand her business and build another big barn for her livestock.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow, a calf, and hay for her livestock to increase organic milk sales

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a resident of Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a widow and engaged in the fish vending business from which she earns a living for her children.  With this business she meet many challenges, but she realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than become discouraged. 

Evelyn works hard to sell all her fish in the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy her fish. With her savings, she welcomes the idea of expanding her business. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan from Paglaum MPC.  Evelyn felt assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. 

Evelyn smiles at the thought of seeing her children and even her grandchildren having a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish for selling.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement a été mise en place le 03 Juillet 2002 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Il est composé de femmes animées d’une volonté manifeste d’améliorer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles vivent toutes dans la même localité et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (assise à droite la main une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 03 garçons et 04 filles. C’est une femme qui jouit d’une bonne expérience dans le commerce, elle vendeuse de denrées alimentaires (ognon, huile de palme, pâte d’arachide et divers condiments et bouillons culinaires). Elle achète en gros et demi gros pour la revente au détail.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sacs d’ognon, un de pomme de terre, 04 seaux de pâte d’arachide, 02 bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme et divers condiments et bouillons culinaires pour la revente.

 Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer les soins sanitaires des enfants, leur scolarité et habillement en majorité.
texts.en:
This group was set up on July 3, 2002 when it was inaugurated. It is composed of women inspired with an obvious desire to improve their living conditions. All the women live in the same town, and their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Mariama (sitting at the right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 53 years old and a married mother of seven children (3 boys and 4 girls). This is a woman who enjoys good experience in commerce. She is a vendor of grocery items (onions, palm oil, peanut butter, and various condiments and flavorings). She purchases wholesale and demi-wholesale and resells the goods retail. 

With her new loan, she intends to purchase 2 sacks of onions, a sack of potatoes, 4 pails of peanut butter, a couple of 20-liter containers of palm oil, and a variety of condiments and flavorings for resale. 

The profits will enable her to ensure primarily that the children’s healthcare, schooling, and clothing needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase onions, potatoes, peanut butter, and palm oil

loans.name: Grupo  Xojola Sector Loma Group

texts.es:
Uno de los negocios característicos de Suchitepéquez es la crianza de animales de todo tipo. Desde hace 3 años Marta de 26 años, quien vive en su comunidad, se dedica a la   crianza de pollos, negocio que genera una satisfactoria ganancia para el beneficio de su familia y para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hijo. Ella tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad por quien lucha cada día el estudia en la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad. (Marta es la que se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha la que tiene puesta una blusa de color negro en la fotografía)

La actividad que ella realiza es la compra, venta y crianza de pollos en la comunidad donde ella vive, a ella le genera ganancias buenas porque no tiene competencia en dicho negocio y le ayuda a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.

Hace una solicitud de préstamo para la compra de pollos de granja y criollos y como también la compra de concentrado para pollos y así genera más ganancias para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y apoyar a su comunidad en un desarrollo hacia el futuro.
Ella es un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se unió a Marta para emprender juntas el negocio de crianza de pollos.
	
Son sus metas para generar más ingresos y el sostenimiento de su familia y seguir en la crianza de pollos y la compra de un molino de nixtamal y que su hijo sea profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
One of the typical business activities in Suchitepéquez is raising all kinds of animals. Marta, 26, who lives in this community, has been raising chickens for three years. This business generates a satisfactory income to benefit her family and improve her son's quality of life. She has one six-year-old son, for whom she fights every day. He is studying at the local school. In the photo, Marta is first from the left wearing a black shirt.

Marta's business activity is buying, raising and selling chickens in her community. She earns a good income because she does not have competition in this business. This helps her to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

She is applying for a loan to buy farm and Creole chickens, as well as chicken feed. She will then earn a higher profit to improve her family's living conditions and support her community's future development. She is an example in her community, which is why a group of women joined her to launch the business of raising chickens together.

Marta's goals are to earn a higher income, sustain her family, continue raising chickens, buy a corn mill, and for her son to be a professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm and Creole chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Nimia Celinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Nimia Celinda; la socia continua trabajando en uno de los colegios de la zona, la socia es docente de profesión, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como plumones entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank "SAN VALENTIN".  The bank is located in the Cusco district, being part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.  

The member's name is Señora Nimia Celinda, and she continues working in one of the area high schools.  She is a teacher by profession and is a responsible and determined person, and because of this she has gotten her family ahead.

She is requesting this loan to purchase educational materials such as felt-tip pens, among other materials.  She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy educational materials such as felt-tip pens, among other materials.

loans.name: Agripina Matilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA TERMINAL, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Agripina Matilde tiene 38 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una empresa de transporte el cual brinda servicio interprovincial, la socia lleva buen tiempo en su trabajo  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el manteniendo de un carro.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Agripina Matilde is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Huanca Termina” which is located in the Districto of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. She is 38 years old and married. Agripina Matilde divides her time between her daily activities and working at her transportation business that provides service between provinces. She has been in this type of work for a long time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day. Agripina wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to perform maintenance on a car. Agripina appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr: Âgée de 61ans, madame Dodji est veuve et a en charge 04enfants. Malgré son âge, elle se bat chaque jour pour vendre afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des chaussures au marché et demande un troisième crédit pour acheter des chaussures. Dodji désire avoir sa propre maison avec le profit réalisé et tout en gardant pérenne son activité.
texts.en: Aged 61, Madame Dodji is a widow and is responsible for four children. Despite her age, she struggles every day to make enough sales to cover the needs of her family. She has been selling shoes at the market and is asking for her third loan to buy more shoes. Dodji wishes to have her own home with the profit she makes and also to keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Saly's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement a été mise en place le 03 Juillet 2002 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Il est composé de femmes animées d’une volonté manifeste d’améliorer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles vivent toutes dans la même localité et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Saly (assise à droite la main une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 34 ans est mariée sans enfant en charge. Elle est très active dans le groupement et connais une bonne progression depuis son adhésion. Elle est vendeuse de légumes et de poisson sec au marché de la commune. Elle achète le poisson sec au marché international par panier ainsi que les légumes pour la revente par détail dans sa commune. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans le commerce de détail.

Avec son prêt, elle compte payer 02 paniers de poissons secs, un carton de choux, de carotte et divers légumes pour la revente.

Elle utilisera les bénéfices en partie à augmenter son épargne et développer son commerce d’autre part à aider son mari à améliorer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was set up on July 3, 2002 when it was inaugurated. It is composed of women inspired with an obvious desire to improve their living conditions. All the women live in the same town, and their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Saly (sitting at the right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 34 years old, married, and without any children to support. She is very active in the group and has experienced good progress since joining it. She is a vendor of vegetables and dried fish at the commune market, She purchases dried fish by the basket at the international market, as well as vegetables, to resell in her commune. She enjoys much experience in retail commerce. 

With her new loan, she intends to purchase 2 baskets of dried fish, a box of cabbages, some carrots, and various vegetables to resell.  

She will use the profits in part to increase her savings and to develop her commerce, as well as to help out her husband in alleviating day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for dried fish, cabbage, carrots, and various vegetables to resell

loans.name: Turamirize Group

texts.fr:
Mugeni fait partie du groupe  Turamirize et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 34 ans et est mariée à Séverin ,un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 3 à 18 ans, dont 4 étudient.
 

Elle fait le commerce de  riz  depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est son onzième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Mugeni is part of the group Turamirize and lives in Bujumbura. She is 34 years old and married to Séverin, a merchant. Together they have six children, from 3 to 18 years old, of whom four are students. 

Mugeni has been doing commerce in rice for ten years.

She is on her 11th Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of rice to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a parcel of land and see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Ruvumera Group

texts.fr:
Egide  fait partie du groupe  Ruvumera et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 32 ans et est marié à Aline ,une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 1 à 4 ans.
 
Il fait le commerce de  draps  depuis  3 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  draps  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Egide is part of the group Ruvumera and lives in Bujumbura. He is 32 years old and married to Aline, a merchant. Together they have two children, 1 and 4 years old.

Egide has been doing commerce in bedsheets for three years. 

He is on his second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase many bedsheets to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a parcel of land and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many bedsheets to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase containers (bowls, tubs) to resell and also the raw materials for making shoes

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 37 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 school age children.

Maria Teresa has been engaged in the nipa hut (a traditional stilt house) weaving and production business for 20 years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity which is of a great help towards her family income. She has requested a loan to be used in paying for nipa leaves and the labor costs of nipa hut weaving and production.

Maria Teresa has been a member of PMPC for just this year. In the future, Maria Teresa hopes to expand her nipa hut weaving and production business.

loans.use: to be used to pay for nipa leaves and the labor costs of nipa hut weaving and production.

loans.name: Rochelyn

texts.en:
Rochelyn lives in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married and has 2 kids. Her husband is a fisherman who never gets tired of supporting their family. 

In 2013, she applied for membership to Paglaum MPC. After hearing all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one. She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always pay her loans in a timely manner.
