Jimy is the coordinator for his group, Victorie de Bordemer. He is unmarried and has one child. Jimy lives in the Northern region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and drinkable water very limited. He has managed his basket retail business for the past four years.

Jimy hopes that this loan will help him grow his business and buy materials to make baskets. Other members of Victorie de Bordemer need loans for retail businesses for cosmetics, fish, soft drinks, charcoal, and other miscellaneous products.

Jimy says that his main goal is to own a bigger business, which will make it possible for him to travel in other American countries such as Panama, Peru, and Mexico.

loans.use: to buy basket-making materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
A senhora Maria e comerciante de 49 anos de idade , mae viúva de 5 filhos dos quais 1 estuda os restantes são maiores de idade, vive na casa própria sustenta sua mae enviando lhe dinheiro.
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar açúcar, feijão, amendoim, oleo para reforçar o seu negócio tem uma barraca em casa.
Projecto para o futuro diz que irá construir dependências na sua casa para arrendar como forma de reforçar a renda familiar.
Diz que seus desafios sao saturaçāo do mercado e que irá solicitar mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 49-year-old vendor. She's a widowed mother of five children, one of whom is in school and the other ones are adults. She lives in a house that she owns and supports her mother by sending her money.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase sugar, beans, peanuts and cooking oil in order to boost her business, which she runs from a booth at her house.
She states that her project for the future is to build rooms in her house for renting out as a way of improving her family's income.
She states that her challenge is an overcrowded market, and that she'll apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, peanuts, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.es: Eliezer vive en concubinato desde hace 6 años y tiene dos hijos El cliente comparte la vivienda con los padres de su pareja, la familia vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que no tiene deficiencias Eliezer es costurero y esta expuesto a accidentes con máquinas de costura y necesita un prestamo para compra de telas e hilos para sus diversos productos, la pareja de Eliezer le ayuda con los trabajos de costura pero  no tiene ingresos por eso Eliezer necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Eliezer has been in a common-law relationship for the past six years and has two children. He shares his home with his partner’s parents. They live in El Alto in a brick and cement house that has no defects.

Eliezer is a tailor who has had accidents with sewing machines. He needs a loan in order to buy fabrics and thread for making different products. His partner helps him with the sewing work. Since he has no income, Eliezer is in need of assistance.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread for his business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia Vilma  se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This partner, Vilma, sells beauty products. She sells lipsticks, creams and perfumes. She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm. She's been running this business for many years. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell her beauty products. This member is requesting a loan to buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes.

She is happy to receive a loan and promises to pay her installments.

loans.use: buy creams, lipstick and perfumes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married male of 42 years with four children, of whom three attend school. He resides in Masindi and carries out a transport business. The client has additional income from a retail shop. He started the business to supplement his earnings from the transport business and his clients are mainly traders. 

David has hopes of expanding his businesses and educating his children. David's major challenge is the increasing cost of spare parts. He wants a loan to service his vehicles.

loans.use: to pay for the servicing of his vehicles.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet, who used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season, is a forty-six-year-old female and mother of five children. She resides in Masindi and operates a stall as a market vendor where she sells clothes. 

Harriet wants a loan to buy more clothes to sell to her customers. She hopes to educate her children and complete her house. However, she faces a challenge of inadequate capital. She is a hardworking and committed woman.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a thirty nine year old, hard-working, married man with four children living in Kamwenge Uganda. 

He owns a retail shop as his main source of income though he also earns additional income from farming and motorcycle (boda boda) transport. He started these businesses to boost his income and look after his family. His main challenge is high inflation, though he hopes to have a stable business and educated children. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a fridge, and items like soap, bags of sugar and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, and items like soap, bags of sugar and others to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 21 years old from Maria Aurora, Aurora. He is taking up Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. He chose this course because it is in demand here in the Philippines and abroad. Though sometimes he loses hope because of poverty, John still pursues his studies to achieve his dreams. To help him fund his schooling, he wants to avail himself of an educational loan of 15,000 PHP from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Iranete

texts.pt:
A senhora  Iranete de 27 anos é comerciante, mae de 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino primario e o outro ainda e menor.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar fardos de roupa usada para revender  reforcando o seu negocio que faz no mercado da zona onde vive.
Tem como projectos e sonhos crescer no seu negocio responder todas as necessidades dos seus clientes  terminar a construcao de sua casa e comprar uma viatura.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
27-year-old Iranete is a vendor. She has two children, one of whom attends elementary school and the other one is under school age.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase bundles of used clothing for re-selling. That way she'll boost the business she runs at the local market.
She states that her projects and dreams are to make her business grow, meet all her customers' needs, finish building her house and buy a vehicle.
She states that the main challenges she has faced are financial, and she uses rotating credit as a way of saving her money. She also states that she'll apply for more loans so that she can achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is 45 years old and has two children. She sells fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family.

Susan buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. Palawan is one of the islands that has the sweetest and most abundant fresh fish caught in the Philippines. Local residents and tourists in her community are her regular customers, who always crave fish rather than pork or beef. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

Susan is requesting a 13,000-PHP loan to buy more fresh fish. Her earnings help her meet their daily personal and household needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

In the future, she wants her business to continue to flourish and to send her children to school. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fish to sell

loans.name: Jay Mary

texts.en: Jay Mary is from Maria Aurora, Aurora. She is taking up Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. She wants to finish college to give her family a better life. But she knows that studying is expensive. That’s why she wants to ask for 15,000 PHP in financial assistance from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a hardworking, married man with five children aged 10, 8, 7, 5 and 2, living in Kamwenge Uganda. He owns a retail shop as his main source of income alongside farming. He used his previous loan funds to buy rice to offer for sale. 

He started these businesses mainly to boost his family income. His main challenges are inflation and price fluctuations, however he hopes to have a financially stable home and business. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more items like bags of sugar, rice, maize flour and soap for his retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more items like bags of sugar, rice, maize flour and soap for his retail shop.

loans.name: Anton

texts.en: Anton needs your financial help again to expand his existing activity by stocking up on car oil, lubricants, and replacement parts that he needs for his auto-parts store. Anton would like to thank all his lenders who generously helped him previously and wish them a happy season ahead.

loans.use: to expand his existing activity by stocking up on inventory items for his auto-parts store.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
This is Roza, a 33-year-old woman, who’s been married to Kujtim. Together they have a daughter who is eight years old and has had nose surgery to repair damages from birth. Prior to coming to the current little city of Lezha, they lived in a very rural village under very difficult living conditions. Roza works in a nearby restaurant whereas her husband works as a welder in a nearby hydro central. 

Roza and Kujtim need your financial help to buy a refrigerator. “The food get rotten easily and we have been wasting our money throwing the food away or starving ourselves or getting food poisoning. Sometimes we re-cook the meal until it loses all nutrients; we are more concerned about our daughter. We had some little money saved, yet we paid for our daughter’s surgical procedure. We would very much appreciate the help from lenders," said both of them almost at the same time.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Fabienne

texts.fr: Fabienne vit à Aquin dans une ville du département du sud d'Haiti. Elle est célibataire et elle a un enfant. Fabienne est commerçante, elle veut augmenter son stock avec des produits énergétiques renouvelables EarthSpark Enèji Pwòp, elle revient vers nous pour son premier prêt.
texts.en:
Fabienne lives in Aquin, in a city of Haiti’s southern region. She is single and has one child.

Fabienne is a retailer who wants to build her stock with renewable energy products from EarthSpark Enèji Pwòp. She is coming to us for her first loan.

loans.use: to buy renewable energy products.

loans.name: Jean Michel

texts.fr: Jean Michel vit à la ville des Cayes dans le département du sud d'Haiti. Jean Michel fait de l'ébénisterie. Il est célibataire et il a un enfant. Avec ce prêt kiva Jean Michel va acheter des produits Energies Renouvelables. Jean Michel veut aider sa famille, il revient vers nous pour son premier prêt.
texts.en:
Jean Michel lives in Cayes city in Haiti’s southern region. Jean Michel is a craft carpenter. He is single and has one child.

With this Kiva loan, Jean Michel will purchase renewable energy products. Jean Michel wants to help his family. He is turning to us for his first loan.

loans.use: to buy renewable energy products.

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
A  senhora Laura de 50 anos de idade é mãe solteira de 2 filhos dos quais 1 ja independente e outro a estudar no  ensino primario sustenta uma  e um neto que vivem com ela.
Com o valor irá comprar varroes, areia, pedra, cimento e janelas para dar continuidade a sua obra. 
Para o futuro a cliente tem como sonho terminar a sua obra fazer um salao de cabeleireiro dando mais melhores condições a sua familia.
Os principais desafios que a cliente tem são financeiros e para supera-los diz que que vai solicitar mais créditos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Laura is 50 years old. She's a single mother of two children, one of whom is independent and the other one is in elementary school. She also supports a grandson who lives with her.
With the loan she'll purchase rods, sand, rocks, cement and windows in order to continue the construction work.
Her dream for the future is to finish the construction work and set up a hair salon, thus improving her family's living conditions.
The main challenges she has faced are financial. In order to overcome them, she states that she'll apply for more loans so that she can achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase rods, sand, rocks, cement and windows.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al trbajo en una institucion publica,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es mejorar en su trbajo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to work at a public institution. Through his job, he wants to get ahead. His dream is to improve in his work.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy sound equipment for his house. He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for his house.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia, age 55, is from Kauswagan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Her husband is a fisherman who never get tired of supporting their family.

Letecia joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Co-op. The Co-op supported her by providing the capital to start her fish vending business. Recently, Letecia requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from the Co-op to purchase new nets, floats and other fishing accessories to increase her catch.

From her desire to help her husband in supporting their family, she gives her best effort to sell all their catch. She is aslo able to buy the catch from her neighbors to resell, in order to continue putting food on the table for her family. Someday she will be happy seeing her children have stable jobs and owning a small space to display her fish in the public market.

loans.use: purchase of new nets, floats, and other fishing accessories.

loans.name: Pioleta

texts.en:
Pioleta is from Unidos, Plaridel, Philippines. She is married with 4 adult-age children.

Pioleta joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Co-op. The Co-op supported her by providing the capital to start her snack vending business. Helping the family survive, she works hard to make delicious food snacks.

Pioleta is now trying to expand her resources; she decided to acquire a motorcycle to be used in selling her food snacks all over the municipality and nearby towns as well. Now, she asks for financial assistance from PMPC to buy more raw ingredients for food snacks vending. She wishes to own food carts to be placed in schools or highways to raise more income for her family and to live life more comfortably with them.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients for making food snacks.

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en: Jayson is 23 years old from Maria Aurora, Aurora. He is taking up Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. He chose this course to easily get a job since it is in demand. It is poverty that drives him to study. And he wants to avail himself of an educational loan of 15,000 PHP from the Kiva lenders to help him in his school expenses.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es: Juan es un joven soltero, tiene 2 hijos de 2 años y 4 años de edad, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a trabajar al jornal,  Juan visita a la madre de sus hijos y a sus niños para velar que no les haga falta lo más indispensable, paga el arriendo de la casa, les compra ropa, alimentos y se ocupa de la salud de sus hijos, este crédito Juan lo va a invertir en la compra de una vacona por la que paga arriendo de hierba para criarla, la aspiración de Juan aspira salir adelante  mediante su trabajo y su negocio para darles a sus hijos la mantención y que mejore la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a single young man who has two children, ages 2 and 4. He raises cattle and also works as a farm laborer. Juan visits his children and their mother so that they are not lacking any of the necessities. He pays the rent on the house and buys their clothes and food. Juan is also concerned about the health of his children.

He will invest this loan in the purchase of a cow. Juan will rent a pasture where the animal can graze and be kept. His aspiration is to move forward in his work and his business so that he can provide for his children and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman. She has six children, all of whom attend school. Hadija owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Hadija operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Angelino

texts.pt:
O senhor  Angelino de 26 anos é comerciante, pai de 3 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino primario e os outros ainda sao menores.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar omo,caixas de oleo,sacos de arroz,embalagens de acuçar,caixas de cremora,  para reforçar o seu negocio.
Tem como projectos e sonhos crescer no seu negocio responder todas as necessidades de seus clientes  terminar a construção de sua casa e comprar uma viatura.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Angelino is 26 years old and a vendor. He has three children, one of whom is in elementary school and the other ones are below school age.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase laundry detergent, boxes of cooking oil, sacks of rice, and boxes of creamer, so he can stock his business.
His projects and dreams are to make his business grow, meet all his customers' needs, finish building his house and buy a vehicle.
He states that the main challenges he has faced are financial, and he uses rotating credit as a way of saving his money. He also states that he'll apply for more loans so that he can achieve his plan.

loans.use: to purchase laundry detergent, boxes of cooking oil, sacks of rice, and boxes of creamer.

loans.name: Elenor

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Elenor works hard to support her family.

Elenor has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and a pig-raising business. Elenor is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing equipment and repair her fishing boat.

Elenor has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
O senhor Francisco de 57 anos de idade é casado, pai de 5 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino secundario e 4 ja sao independentes sustenta  e um neto que vivem com ele.
Com o valor irá comprar varroes, areia, pedra, cimento e janelas para dar continuidade a sua obra. 
Para o futuro a cliente tem como sonho terminar a sua obra, aumentar a casa para melhorar as condições habitacionais da sua familia.
Os principais desafios que a cliente tem são financeiros e para supera-los diz que que vai solicitar mais créditos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Francisco is 57 years old and married. He has five children, one of whom is in secondary school and four are already independent. He supports a grandson who lives with him.
With the loan he'll purchase rods, sand, rocks and cement so he can continue the construction work.
His dreams for the future are to finish the construction work and enlarge his house in order to improve his family's living conditions.
The main challenges he has faced are financial. In order to overcome them, he states that he'll apply for more loans so he can achieve his plan.

loans.use: to purchase rods, sand, rocks, cement, and windows.

loans.name: Eria

texts.pt:
A  senhora Eria e comerciante de 39 anos de idade é casada mae de 2 filhos todos a estudarem no ensino secundario vive na casa própria e nao sustenta mais ninguem alem de seus filhos.
Com o valor irá comprar tijoleira, cimento e pagar a mao de obra de seu pedreiro dar continuidade a sua obra. 
Para o futuro a cliente tem como sonho  fazer uma moageira na sua casa como forma de reforçar a sua renda familiar.
Os principais desafios que a cliente tem são financeiros e para supera-los diz que que vai solicitar mais créditos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Eria is a 39-year-old vendor. She's married and has two children, both of whom are in secondary school. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else other than her children.
With the loan she'll purchase tiles and cement, and pay for her mason's labor so that she can continue the construction work.
Her dream for the future is to build a mill at her house as a way of improving her family's income.
The main challenges she has faced are financial. In order to overcome them, she states that she'll apply for more loans so she can achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase tiles and cement, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Acacio

texts.pt:
O senhor Acacio 57 anos de idade é casado, pai de 6 filhos dos quais 3 frequentam o ensino secundario e 2 no ensino primario 1 ainda e menor de idade.
Com o valor irá comprar varroes, areia, pedra, cimento e janelas para dar continuidade a sua obra. 
Para o futuro a cliente tem como sonho terminar a sua obra, adiquirir uma motorizada para facilitar suas deslocações.
Os principais desafios que a cliente tem são financeiros e para supera-los diz que que vai solicitar mais créditos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Acacio is 57 years old and married. He has six children, three of whom are in secondary school, two are in primary school and one is below school age.
With the loan he'll purchase rods, sand, rocks, cement and windows so he can continue the construction work.
His dreams for the future are to finish the construction work and acquire a moped to make it easier for him to get around.
The main challenge he has faced are financial. He states that in order to overcome them, he'll apply for more loans so he can achieve his plan.

loans.use: to purchase rods, sand, rocks, cement, and windows.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is from Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. She is married and has four adult-aged children.

Perla has a business making and selling "Suman." Suman is a kind of food snack that is made of rice and other ingredients. Suman is one of the best delicacies in the province. She has been in the business for 10 years and it's doing well.

In 2010, Perla applied her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to join. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Perla is asking for financial assistance in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy additional raw ingredients for Suman-making and to buy materials and equipment used for cooking. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and to expand her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients and equipment for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Petchy

texts.en:
Petchy is 26 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Petchy has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, snack foods and school supplies.

Petchy has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, snack foods and school supplies

loans.name: Aida

texts.pt:
A  senhora Aida de 35 anos de idade e mae solteira de 5 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam o ensino secundario e 3 no primario nao sustenta mais ninguem alem de seus filhos.
Com o valor irá comprar varroes, areia, pedra, cimento e janelas para dar continuidade a sua obra. 
Para o futuro a cliente tem como sonho terminar a sua obra e mobilar sua casa dando mais conforto a sua familia.
Os principais desafios que a cliente tem são financeiros e para supera-los diz que que vai solicitar mais créditos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Aida is 35 years old. She's a single mother of five children, two of whom are in secondary school and three are in primary school. She doesn't support anyone else other than her children.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase rods, sand, rocks, cement and windows so that she can continue the construction work.
Her dream for the future is to finish the construction work and furnish her house, thus providing more comfort for her family.
The main challenges she has faced are financial. She states that in order to overcome them, she'll apply for more loans so she can achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase rods, sand, rocks, cement, and windows.

loans.name: Roseville

texts.en:
Roseville is 41 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Roseville is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Roseville has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Roseville would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Lorna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Lorna has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 43 years old and has four children. She is married, and two of her children are in school.

Erma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy pigs and repair her pig cage.

Erma has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Erma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy pigs and repair her pig cage.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Marilou requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Marilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman who has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanaisha has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He owns a poultry project and sells milk to add to his income generation. He sells his products to restaurants and hotels. He hopes to educate his children to higher institutions of learning although he faces a challenge of the high price of chicken feed.

He wants a loan to buy poultry feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 27-year-old hardworking single man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in a retail shop business in addition to his grinding machine business. He started these businesses to earn a living. His main challenge is price fluctuations, although he hopes to increase his profits and marry. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more general merchandise like sugar, soap and sweets to sell.

loans.use: to buy more general merchandise like sugar, soap and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
A Senhora Angelina vive na casa propria com dois filhos, um neto e o seu esposo. Ela tem uma banca no mercado grossista onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade, com o presente emprestimo vai aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirir cebola, arroz, acuçar etc. 
O seu sonho é abrir uma merciaria na vila de marracuene mais tem dificuldades financeiras para a concretização.
texts.en:
Angelina lives with two children, a grandson and her husband in a house that she owns. She owns a booth at the wholesale market where she sells products that are household staples. With the current loan she'll stock her business by purchasing onions, rice, sugar, etc.
Her dream is to open a grocery store in the town of Marracuene, but she has financial difficulties achieving that.

loans.use: to purchase onions, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.pt:
O Senhor Ismael é separado, tem dois filhos dos quais apenas um vive com ele. Ele é segurança  e pedreiro. Com o presente emprestimo vai comprar material de construção (30 sacos de cimento, 13 chapas de zinco, uma porta e uma janela) para dar continuidade com a sua obras de construção de dependências para arrendar. 
O seu maior sonho é concluir as obras, estas servirão como fonte de receita para a familia.
texts.en:
Ismael is separated and has two children, only one of whom lives with him. He's a security guard and a mason. With the current loan he'll purchase construction supplies (3 bags of cement, 13 zinc plates, a door and a window) so that he can continue building additional rooms for renting out.
His biggest dream is to finish building the rooms that will become a source of income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (30 bags of cement, 13 zinc plates, a door and a window).

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es una mujer de 50 años de edad, viuda, tiene un hijo de 18 y una hija de 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de prendas de vestir de lana.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, buena madre, fuerte, decidida, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en distintas zonas de la ciudad como la ’ceja de El Alto’ y la ‘feria 16 de julio’; ambos lugares son muy populares y comerciales.
Natividad es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es típica (pollera, manta y sombrero), su lengua materna es el aymara el cual utiliza muy poco, habla español para el comercio. Su trabajo es la venta de ropa de lana como; guantes, gorros, ropa de bebe. Su vida la comparte con sus dos hijos; el mayor trabaja como chofer y la hija menor estudia en la escuela secundaria, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su sueño es producir la ropa que vende para que su hija tenga un negocio con el cual pueda vivir, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina tejedora para que su hija la maneje y ambas vendan la ropa
Es por esos motivos que Natividad solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina tejedora para que su hija tenga un negocio propio para vivir.
texts.en:
Natividad, 50, is widowed and has an 18-year-old son and a 15-year-old daughter. She sells woolen clothing.

She is enterprising, a fighter, a good mother, strong, determined, responsible and hard working. Her business includes ambulant sales in different areas of the city, such as the ’ceja de El Alto’ and the ‘feria 16 de julio’; both places are very popular and commercial.

Natividad has a dark complexion, is of medium height, has long black braided hair, and wears typical dress (skirt, poncho and hat). Her mother tongue is aymara but she seldom speaks it; she speaks Spanish for commerce. She sells woolen clothing, such as gloves, hats and baby clothes.

She shares her life with her two children; the eldest works as a chauffeur and the youngest is in high school. They live in a rented house that covers all of their basic needs. Her dream is to have her daughter produce the clothing that they sell, so that her daughter can have her own business. She would like to buy a loom that her daughter can use to make the clothing that they will sell.

Natividad is requesting a loan to buy a loom that her daughter will use and thus have a business of her own to live from.

loans.use: buy a loom for her daughter so she can have a business of her own to live from.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 21-year-old married man who started nine years ago repairing, buying and selling motorcycles to cover the needs and expenses of his family who suffers from a low financial situation. He is the sole breadwinner for the seven members of his family
.
After Abdullah got married, the expenses and needs increased and his income is not enough anymore to cover them all. Thus, he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy a van to start an extra transportation services business so that he can increase his income and satisfy his family’s needs and requests.

Abdullah hopes to expand his business and buy a big bus in the upcoming future to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To buy a van to start an extra transportation services business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building the floor of her house and to buy a wardrobe [closet].

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is a forty-four-year-old married male with four children attending school. He is a salary earner and also gets additional income from a motorcycle transport business and a produce business, which he started to supplement his salary. 

He wants a loan to buy a second motorcycle for his transport business. His main clients are local people around Masindi town. 

He hopes to educate all his children to university. He is a hardworking man, and his challenge is competition from other businesses.

loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle.

loans.name: Silah

texts.en: Silah, 43, has a mixed-farm where he is based with his family of three in Lessos in South Rift Kenya. On the farm, he grows various crops and keeps dairy cattle and poultry. For the last six years, he has made money selling his farm's produce and engaging in other side businesses. He feels passionate about farming. However, his business is facing challenges such as the high cost of inputs and occasional drought. Silah is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. The upside, to Silah, of focusing more on his poultry business is that it is not very much affected by the major challenges he faces of the high cost of farm inputs and drought. Poultry feed is readily available. They also lay eggs regardless of the season of the year. This investment will provids a certain source of income all year round. The money Silah will make from this expansion will cater to his family expenses such as food and school fees. He wants his family to enjoy a balanced diet to grow strong and healthy so that they can be more productive towards generating income for the family.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Silvina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

Silvina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 49 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school.

Tessie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Tessie has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns an income from her restaurant.

Tessie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Chaka

texts.en:
Chaka is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan of KES 30,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ndoc

texts.en: Ndoc hasn't finished repairing the family's rundown house yet; however, he is happy with the work he has done so far and now he wants to plaster the outside walls. This is the reason why he is seeking your financial help hoping that you will lend to him again this time.

loans.use: To repair the rundown family home before the bitter winter starts again.

loans.name: Ningome

texts.en:
Ningome is a married woman who has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Nikola

texts.en:
Nikola is a 48-year-old married man and a father of two children who are 25 and 21 years old. He needs your financial help to stock up on inventory items to resell.
 
He is a former police officer who was involved in an accident while at work in 1997 at the age of 31 and since then, he’s been receiving a disability income. He’s been trying to earn some extra cash for his family by selling mostly cigarettes on the streets.  “ it hasn’t been any easy for me and also for my family, financial wise. However, I have tried to do my very best to earn something on the site, because the disability income is very, very small and is not enough for one person, let alone for the entire family,” said Nikola.  

The amount that Nikola is requesting from Kiva lenders is 250,000 Albanian Lek and he is promising that he will pay it back on time, without any delays.

loans.use: to buy inventory items to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in galvanized sheet metal, beams and wood in order to add a roof to his house.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a married male with four children. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He has got a butcher shop that sells meat. He started the business to earn a living. He hopes to educate his children to a university level. He faces a challenge of competition and animal diseases, especially foot and mouth disease.

Abdul wishes to take a loan to buy cows to slaughter to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to slaughter to sell.

loans.name: Andrea Margoth

texts.es: Andrea es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 7 meses, 2 años y  6 años de edad, ella vive con sus padres y sus hijos, la hija de 6 años  asiste a la escuela, Andrea vive  en el campo y se dedica a la crianza de animales y hace un años que se dedica a  sembrar unas pequeñas huertas de papas y de otros productos y   propios de su medio, Andrea necesita el crédito para la compra de fungicidas y pago de mano de obra a las personas que le ayudan a mantener sanos sus cultivos, lo que Andrea aspita es mejorar su negocio y llegar a hacer cultivos más grandes para que mejore sus ganancia y de ahí darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en: Andrea is a single mother, who has three children 7 months, 2 years and 6 years old. She lives with her parents and her children. The 6-year-old girl goes to school. Andrea lives in the countryside and works raising animals and some time ago, she began to plant small plots of potatoes and other products appropriate for her environment. Andrea needs a loan to purchase fungicides and pay for labor and the people who help her to keep her crops healthy. What Andrea aspires to do is improve her business and grow larger crops so that her profits increase and from there to give her children everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase fungicides.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Wilson is married and has nine children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 45 years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, bananas and wood rock, and they also keep livestock. Wilson is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Wilson's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Wilson's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Mwanahalima

texts.en:
Mwanahalima is a married woman and has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school.  They live in their own house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanahalima has operated a fish-selling business for over two years, selling to passersby. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and spoilage leading to losses.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another businesses in the near future

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
O Senhor Jorge vive maritalmente na casa propria, tem qutro filhos menores de idade dos quais três andam na escola. Ele é professor e com o presente emprestimo vai regularizar o seu espaço. 
O seu maior sonho é continuar com os estudos ate fazer o doctoramento
texts.en:
Jorge is married and lives in a house that he owns. He has four underage children, three of whom are in school. He's a teacher, and with the current loan he'll acquire the deeds to his property.
His biggest dream is to continue his studies up to the level of doctorate.

loans.use: to acquire the deeds to his property.

loans.name: Moises

texts.pt:
O Senhor Moises vive com a sua irmã na casa propria. Ele é servente, com o presente empréstimo vai adiquirir material de construção o ferro, o cimento e a pedra para dar continuidade com a orbra. 
Tem como desafio sustentar os estudos da sua irmã
texts.en:
Moises lives with his sister in a house that he owns. He's a laborer. With the current loan he'll purchase construction supplies such as iron, cement and rocks so that he can continue the construction work.
His challenge is paying for his sister's studies.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as iron, cement and rocks.

loans.name: Vírginia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Virginia de 46 años de edad, está casada y han procreado cuatro hijos, todos son mayores de edad y siempre han coordinado para brindarle a sus hijos la educación y los buenos principios morales, dos de ellos le ayudan a su padre en los trabajos de mecánica automotriz y las hijas le ayudan a su madre en su trabajo de venta de ropa.

Virginia tiene sólida experiencia en la actividad comercial que realiza porque desde pequeña acompañaba a su madre, quien se desempeñaba en el mismo trabajo y por eso ella aprendió y hoy se desempeña perfectamente en la venta de ropa, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y mantener la preferencia de los mismos.

Debido al esfuerzo continuo que Virginia lleva para salir adelante le ha permitido tener un financiamiento crediticio con el cual comprara más ropa para hombre, mujer y niños de toda variedad y ofertársela a sus clientes. Ese esfuerzo lo hace para tener a sus clientes satisfechos con las prendas que les vende, así como también mantener en pie su negocio.

Virginia como toda persona tiene sueños en su vida y ella desea seguir siendo útil y trabajar junto a su esposo como siempre lo ha hecho. Además, espera que Dios le preste mucha vida para ver a sus hijos en sus respectivos hogares y con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Virginia is 46, married, and the mother of four adult children. She has been responsible for  ensuring that her children get an education and instilling sound moral values in them. Virginia's two sons help their father, an auto mechanic, and her daughters help their mother with her clothing business.  

Virginia has a great deal of experience selling clothes, and learned the business when she was very young. Virginia's mother also made a living selling clothes, and Virginia was usually at her side. Virginia thus learned early how to sell clothes, how to treat her customers, and retain their loyalty. Today she is a master of sales and customer service.  

Virginia's steadfast energy have allowed her to improve her situation and obtain a loan. She will use the loan funds to purchase a wide variety of men's, women's and children's clothing and offer them to her customers. Virginia's efforts have resulted in high customer satisfaction with the clothing she sells, and have sustained her business. 

Like everyone else, Virginia has hopes and aspires to remain useful, working together with her husband as she has since they married. She also hopes that God will grant her long life so she can see her children settle down in their own homes and raise their own children.

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of clothing for men, women, and children, and offer them to her customers.

loans.name: Safira

texts.pt:
A Senhora Safira é viuva e vive na casa propria com os seus cinco filhos e dois netos, ela vende produtos alimentares no mercado grossista.  Com o presente empréstimo ela vai adiquirir secador, variedades de mechas e produtos de beleza para abrir um salão de beleza na sua residência. A sua filha mais velha é cabelereira e cuidara do salão.
Ela tem dificuldades financeiras para sustentar a familia.
texts.en:
Safira is a widow. She lives with her five children and two grandchildren in a house that she owns. She sells foodstuffs at the wholesale market. With the current loan she'll purchase a blowdryer and a variety of hair extensions and beauty products in order to open a beauty salon at her house. Her eldest daughter is a hairdresser and she'll be in charge of the salon.
She faces financial difficulties supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase a blowdryer and a variety of hair extensions and beauty products in order to open a beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs (rice, sugar and cooking oil) for his grocery store.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.
La socia MARIA  continua trabajando en una empresa pública, la socia lleva años trabajando para esta empresa el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de víveres para su hogar.
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Our member belongs to the community bank COMUZONE. Our member lives in the city of Cusco in the district of Huanchac in the department of Cusco. The member Maria continue working in a public company. She has worked for this company for years and it has gone well thanks to the hard work she puts forth each day. The member hopes to continue working there in order to continue supporting her family. The member is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her home. The member is thankful and values the support brought through this medium and she promised to comply with loan repayments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her home.

loans.name: Elma Amanda

texts.es:
Elma  de 31 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos. A ella la conocen por una persona emprendedora y de buenos valores morales ha inculcado a sus hijos a ser responsables diariamente en sus actividades escolares. Porque quiere que se preparen académicamente para un futuro mejor.

Elma tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la actividad de comercio específicamente comercializa calzado y es su principal fuente de ingreso, la que le permite llevar el sustento diario para sus hijos. Todos los días se levanta temprano para mandar a sus pequeños a la escuela y posteriormente iniciar sus faenas diarias, porque sus clientes la esperan por su buena atención y amabilidad.

Debido al ritmo de trabajo y perseverancia que Elma lleva cotidianamente le ha permitido obtener un financiamiento crediticio, para comprar más calzado para su comercialización, con ello quiere tener variedad y nuevos estilos para sus clientes porque la demanda es bastante significativa.

Ella espera seguir siendo productiva en su vida y brindarles un buen futuro a sus hijos, porque su mayor anhelo es que sean personas responsables con sus compromisos y que sean profesionales exitosos en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Elma, 31, is a mother to two children. She is known as an enterprising woman with good moral values, who has taught her children to be responsible every day in their scholarly activities. She wants them to be prepared academically so they can have a better future.

Elma has been in commerce for 15 years, specifically shoe sales. This business is her principal source of income and helps her provide for her children every day. She wakes up early every day, sends her children off to school and then starts work because her customers are waiting for her -- they appreciate her good service and kindness.

Due to the pace of her business and some perseverance, Elma has requested a loan to buy more shoes for her business. She wants to have a variety of new styles to supply the significant customer demand.

She hopes to continue being productive in her life and providing her children a good future because her biggest hope is that they will become responsible with their commitments and successful professionals in society.

loans.use: buy more shoes for her business. She wants to have a variety of new styles to supply the significant customer demand.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Susan is married and has two children. She is the women's leader in her local church. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for twenty-four years now, and they are currently growing vegetables, bananas, tea, and fodder. Susan is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for food and medicine.

This is Susan's first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to support one of her children, who is unable to speak. Susan's hope for the future is to have her children educated and to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator so that her food doesn't spoil.

loans.name: Reyna Noemy

texts.es:
Reyna de 22 años de edad, se dedica a la prestación de servicios de oficios domésticos, es una persona muy educada muy conocida en su comunidad por la actividad laboral  y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar  y de esta manera ha logrado salir adelante y ser una persona honesta y servicial.

 Ella ayudaba a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar por las mañanas y por las tardes asistía a la escuela donde logro alcanzar su nivel educativo hasta el 6° grado.

 Con el paso del tiempo adquirió mucha experiencia y conocimientos sobre los oficios domésticos y prestación de servicio y comenzó a trabajar a tiempo completo con su madre ya que ella era la mayor de sus hermanos fue así como se fue independizando y conoció a su esposo con quien decidió casarse y ahora son padres de 1 hijo. Los días que no hay trabajo de doméstica, se dedica junto a su esposo a la agricultura lo cuales le sirven para llevar el sustento diario a su familia.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar laminas, 3 puertas, 1 ventana, cemento para el piso de la casa y materiales para la evacuación de aguas lluvias de su casa. 

Las proyecciones que tienen para el futuro son las de haber cancelado el préstamo y adquirir uno de mayor monto para la implementación de una tienda y destazo de cerdos. Apoyar en la educación de su hijo y mejoramiento de su casa.
texts.en:
22-year-old Reyna works as a domestic employee. She is an educated person, well-known in her community for her hard work. Her parents taught her to work and in this manner she has been able to get ahead and be an honest and helpful person. She helped her mother with household chores in the morning and she attended school through the sixth grade in the afternoon. With the passage of time, she has acquired a lot of experience and knowledge about domestic work and began to work full-time with her mother since she was the oldest of her siblings. She became independent and met her husband who she decided to marry. They are now the parents of one child. On the days that she doesn't work as a domestic employee, she works in agriculture with her husband which enables them to sustain their family. 

They are applying for a loan to buy aluminum sheets, 3 doors, 1 window, cement for the floor of her house, and materials to remove rain water from her house. Their future plans include repaying the loan and acquiring a bigger one in order to build a store and pig pen, supporting their child's education, and improving their home.

loans.use: to buy aluminum sheets, 3 doors, 1 window, cement for the floor of her house, and materials to remove rain water from her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new grill for making tortillas, and replace the old grill that she uses now, which is in poor condition.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annie is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Annie has a nipa-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her nipa-making business.

Annie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Annie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her nipa-making business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 48 years old and married with four children. With three of her children in school, Amelita works very hard to provide for them.

Amelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Amelita has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John used the previous loan to buy fertilizer and pay workers who are weeding his garden. He practices agriculture, and with the proceeds he has been able to earn enough money to build rental houses from which he earns a monthly income. 

He complains of price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes like other farmers. His dream is to become a model farmer in the region. 

John has asked for the loan to buy fertilizers and pay workers to weed his garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay workers to weed his garden.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old and married with four children.  With two of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a furniture-making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business and afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Austreberto

texts.es:
Austreberto de 59 años de edad. Está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, procrearon tres hijos a quienes los han guiado por el camino del bien y les han fomentado los buenos principios y normas de convivencia social.

Austreberto  tiene experiencia en atención al cliente, ya que tiene 30 años de trabajar como empleado en una tienda de productos de consumo, la amabilidad y la buena atención le ha permitido hacer muchos amigos, además de conservar su empleo por largo tiempo lo cual le permite llevar el sustento diario para su familia y  junto a su esposa coordinan las actividades.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar cemento, arena, ladrillos y tejas. Esto para hacerle mejoramientos  y ampliación a su vivienda y así tener un espacio más grande donde cada miembro de la familia este en mejor comodidad. 

Austreberto no deja de trabajar y cada día se mantiene con más deseos de salir adelante, desea seguir estable laboralmente para realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda y en un corto plazo espera tener su propia tienda, para atender las necesidades de sus vecinos y a la vez se convierta en otra fuente de ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
59-year-old Austreberto is married. Her wife works at home. They have three children who they have guided towards a good path and they have fomented good principles and social norms in them. Austreberto has experience in customer service since her has worked in a store for 30 years. His kindness and attentive nature have enabled him to make many friends and keep his job for a long time. This allowed him to support his family and coordinate activities with his wife. 

He is applying for a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy cement, sand, bricks, and ceramic tile. This is to improve and renovate his house so he will have a bigger space in which each member of his family is more comfortable. 

Austreberto doesn't stop working and each day he continues striving to get ahead. He hopes to maintain steady employment in order to improve his house. In the short team, he would like to have his own store in order to attend to his neighbors and have a new source of income for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and ceramic tile. This is to improve and renovate his house.

loans.name: Choquequirao Inc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy ella es soltera y tiene 58 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de zapatos, la socia vende todo tipo de zapatos para mujeres, varones y niños, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos.

Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agencia de viajes.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the community bank Choquequirao Inc. This bank is located in the district of Cusco belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Nancy. She is single and 58-years-old. The member works in a business selling shoes. She sells all different types of shoes for women, men, and children. The members works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. The member has worked in this business for 7 years and it is going very well. The dream of the member is to have a store where she can sell shoes. She is applying for a loan to buy shoes. 

The members who are in the group photo took it after a meeting. The other members have a clothing store, an artisan store, a grocery store, and a travel agency. The member thanks those who form part of her dream through this medium and she promises to comply with the loan payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi has been operating a tailoring business making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Mwanamisi dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread for her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 39 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from raising pigs and selling charcoal.  Alma is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Silvianah

texts.en:
Silvianah has been operating a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of kids' wear clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids' wear clothes for resale

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
His name is Federico, 53, and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippine. He is married to Maria, a businesswoman, and has two children.  He works hard to augment their income to provide for their everyday living expenses and to send his children to school.

Federico has a tricycle unit which he himself drives.  In the Philippines, especially in provinces like Silang, the tricycle is the most common means of transportation.  People ride a tricycle to go to market, church, friends, city hall, and other destinations.  Buses are limited and do not normally pass by the town areas.  It is very important that his tricycle unit is always in a good running condition to ensure continuous service and income.

Federico is requesting for a PHP 10,000 loan assistance to buy spare parts for a good maintenance of his tricycle unit.  His income from his transportation business helps a lot in meeting his family's daily needs and for the schooling of his children.

In the future, he plans to buy another unit of tricycle to improve his income and better provide for his family. He dreams for his children to go to a good school.  He values family and unity. He meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Asya

texts.ru: Ася, 58 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, с 1999 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Все дети, кроме младшего сына живут отдельно, но они активно помогают матери. В хозяйстве Аси на сегодняшний день есть: 2 коровы и 10 овец, 2 лошади, а также земельный надел мерою 1,45 ГА, где Ася выращивает пшеницу и ячмень, на 0,30 ГА земли расположен сад, засаженный грушами. Прибыли от ведения бизнеса катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь, дети помогают Асе материально, но она хочет сама вести бизнес, быть независимой и наоборот помогать своим детям. Поэтому, в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ася обратилась в Банк "Бай Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Аси, а также накопить средства на свадьбу младшего сына.
texts.en:
Asya is 58 and a widow with four children. She has a specialist high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1999. All her children except the youngest son live on their own, but they help their mother actively. Asya currently has two cows, 10 sheep and two horses as well as a 1.45 hectare piece of land on which she grows wheat and barley, and another 0.3 hectares where she has a pear orchard. 

Revenue from her business doesn't come close to covering her living costs, so Asya's children help her financially, but she wants her business to help her live independently from her children and, in turn, help them. Therefore, with the goal of further developing her business, Asya has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 KGS to buy three steers. The profits will help Asya improve her quality of life and save toward her youngest son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase three steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 25 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Florence requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, and school supplies.

Florence has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, and school supplies.

loans.name: Edirisa

texts.en:
Edirisa is a 56-year-old Ugandan, married to Faridah, with whom he has five children aged between 10 and 19. 

His main source of income is farming and he grows coffee, but he also sells dry maize, beans, and millet. He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy produce, i.e., maize and beans. 

His dream for the future is to buy more land for farming and educating his children, but he faces challenges of bad weather and poor road network that affect his activities. He requests UGAFODE to reduce the interest rates.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize for trade

loans.name: Girly Rose

texts.en: Girly Rose, 27 years old, is married and has one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  For the past two years, Girly Rose has had a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more snack foods, rice, sardines and other groceries. In the future, Girly Rose would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods, rice, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Angel Israel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE II,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de cusco.
El socio Ángel continua brindando el servicio  de taxi, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio lleva   buen tiempo dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones personales siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
 Él socio solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Ángel, belongs to Comuzone II Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  He's a responsible and persevering person.

He still provides taxi service.  He has been doing this work for some time, and it gives him personal satisfaction because it's how he gets his family ahead.

Ángel's requesting the loan to buy tires.

He's grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix up her son's room and buy a bed for his comfort.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie, 31 years old, is single and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Margie has run a general store in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested an additional loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to further build her business. Margie will use the loan to buy stock such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. Margie has previously borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF. Margie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods, such as canned goods, shampoo, soap, chips, bread, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Enrique

texts.es:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
El  socio Manuel Enrique tiene 26 años de edad y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias  trabajando para  una institución privada, el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio  es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de un electrodoméstico para su casa.
El  socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member is in the Comuzone II communal bank. This bank is located in the Huanchac District, Cusco Province, Cusco Department. Member Manuel Enrique is 26 years old and is single, he divides his daily tasks with working for a private institution, which he is doing well in due to the effort he puts in to his work every day, the member is a responsible person and enterprising as this is the way that he moves forward with his family.

The member is requesting a loan to buy an appliance for his home. This member is grateful for the support that will be granted and also commits to pay the instalments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy an appliance for his home.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze has operated a food vending business, cooking chapati (flat bread) and dumplings for sale. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Mbodze has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 30-year-old single man, who opened a mini market four years ago in an attempt to increase his income, and to satisfy the needs of his beloved family. He is the sole breadwinner to two other members of his family. 

Today, Hussein is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with special offer products, to satisfy his customers’ needs and provide them with a better service. Hussein hopes to expand his business more in the upcoming future to increase his income and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special offer products.

loans.name: Villa Entre Rios Group

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 50 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos de 19, 18, 11 años y dos hijas de 16, 13 años, y su negocio es la venta de jugos de fruta (naranja).
Ella es buena madre, independiente, luchadora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en ‘Sacaba’ un lugar caracterizado por su clima tropical y comida para todo gusto.
Virginia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, viste de forma típica (pollera, blusa y sombrero), su lengua materna es el quechua y también habla español(al centro de sombrero). La necesidad de ampliar su negocio la ha llevado a formar una banca de personas, todas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo para el beneficio de sus negocios y sus familias. Ella se dedica a la venta de jugos de fruta y lleva con esta actividad más de 15 años, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como chofer y con sus tres hijos menores que aún continúan en la escuela. Su vivienda cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de fruta por mayor y que sus hijos mayores logren estudiar a nivel superior.
Es por esos motivos que Virginia solicita un préstamo para la compra de fruta por mayor y con los beneficios apoyar el estudio superior de dos tres hijos mayores.
texts.en:
Virginia is a woman of 50 years old, married, mother of three sons of 19, 18, 11 years old and two daughters of 16 and 13 years, her business is selling fruit juice (orange). She is a good mother, independent, a real fighter, responsible and hardworking. Her business takes place in 'Sacaba', a place known for its tropical climate and food for all tastes.

Virginia has a dark complexion, long, black, braided hair, she wears traditional clothing (pollera [pleated skirt], blouse and hat), her native language is Quechua and she also speaks Spanish (she is in the centre wearing a hat). 

Her need to expand her business has led her to form a communal bank of people all with different businesses and similar needs to request a loan for the benefit of their businesses and families. 

She works selling fruit juice and has been in this line of work for 15 years, she shares her life with her husband who works as a driver and with her three younger children who are still in school.

Her house has the basic utilities. Her dreams is to expand her business buying fruit wholesale and that her older children will achieve studies at a higher level.

It is for these reasons that Virginia is requesting a loan to buy fruit wholesale and with the profits support the higher studies of two of her three older children.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale and with the profits support her children's studies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, and maize flour from her home to her neighbors.  Fatuma dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future, and she appreciates the support of the previous loan that helped her to support her business.

With the KES 40,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat for her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat for her business.
