loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Antonia earns more income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing/fish vending business.

Antonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luís de 63 años de edad, es casado y su esposa es vendedora en una tienda cercana. Tienen un hijo, al que le han inculcado los buenos principios y el amor al trabajo.

Luís se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que era un niño,  ya que las enseñanzas de su padre iban encaminadas a que él aprendiera la actividad productiva  que un día le permitiría ser auto sostenible en materia de granos básicos.  También posee conocimientos de mecánica. Cuando tenía 15 años se interesó por adquirir conocimientos de mecánica automotriz y desde entonces aprendió el oficio el cual le ha heredado a su hijo y hoy realizan juntos los trabajos.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar llaves, destornilladores, cables, etc, ya que desea abrir un taller automotriz.  Puesto que, las herramientas que tiene para realizar dicha actividad son muy pocas y necesita más que le ayuden a realizar el trabajo con mayor facilidad y así brindar un completo servicio a sus clientes.

Luis espera ser el mecánico más reconocido en la zona y quiere trabajar con dedicación para que sus clientes mantengan la preferencia por los servicios de calidad que se prestaran en su taller. Desea que este trabajo sea su principal fuente de ingresos que le permita tener una estable economía familiar y en un futuro realizar mejoramientos en su vivienda. Además anhela que su hijo siga sus pasos y que al llegar a faltar, sea él quien mantenga en pie el taller.
texts.en:
Luís, 63, is married. His wife is a salesperson in a local store. They have one son, in whom they have instilled good principles and a love of work.

Luís has been working in agriculture since he was a boy. His father taught him about this productive activity, which would allow him to be self-sufficient in basic grains one day. He also has knowledge of mechanics. When he was 15 years old, he became interested in gaining knowledge about auto mechanics and started learning about the profession. He has passed this knowledge on to his son, and now they work together.

He is applying for a loan to buy keys, screwdrivers, cables, etc. because he wants to open an auto shop. He has very few tools for this business activity, and they need more to help them work with greater facility, thereby offering clients a full service.

Luís hopes to be the most well-known mechanic in the area, and he wants to work with dedication so that his clients continue to prefer the good-quality service offered in his shop. He wants this work to be his main source of income, which will allow him to have a stable home economy and make improvements to his home in the future. Furthermore, he hopes that his son will follow in his footsteps and keep up the shop if he is not there.

loans.use: to buy keys, screwdrivers, cables, etc. to open an auto shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.
La socia Cristina tiene 54 años de edad y  tiene 01 hijo  ,la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una agencia de turismo, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de boletos turísticos.
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Comuzone communal bank. She lives in the city of Cusco in the district of Huanchac, which belongs to the department of Cusco. Cristina is 54 years old and has one son. She alternates her daily activities with her work in a tourism agency. She has been working for a good amount of time, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her work every day. She would like to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for a loan to buy tourist tickets. She is grateful for the help being offered to her by means of this loan, and she promises to comply with the repayment of her debt within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita continues working in her business, a grocery store. She sells products that are staples such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies, this member works from 8:00am to 7:00pm, she has been in this business for 5 years and she is doing well. Her dream is to expand her business, the grocery store. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The member is happy to receive a loan and commits to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El socio Raul se sigue dedicando al negocio de panaderia,el socio prepara panes y pasteles, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de panaderia.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar harina, huevos y mantequilla para preparar los panes y pasteles.

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Raul is still working in his bakery. He makes bread and cakes. Through his work, he wants to get ahead. His dream is to expand his bakery. He is applying for a loan to buy flour, eggs, and butter to make bread and cakes.

Raul is grateful for this loan and promises to comply with the payment of his installments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and butter to make bread and cakes.

loans.name: Goodluck

texts.en:
Goodluck used the previous loan to pay labour for tea plantation maintenance. He is a farmer whose dream is to own a bigger tea plantation. 

His major challenge is inadequate labor to work on the plantation. Goodluck is requesting this loan to pay labour costs involved in the maintenance of the plantation.

loans.use: to pay labour for tea plantation maintenance.

loans.name: Ferlina

texts.en:
Ferlina is 42 years old and widowed. With two children, both of whom are in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ferlina would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has been operating a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Rehema is requesting KES 50,000 to boost her kiosk and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat  She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

loans.use: to boost her kiosk and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. She has operated a food vending business for the past three years, cooking chapati (flat bread) rice and beans. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of KES 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business.

loans.name: Marsel

texts.en:
Marsel is seeking your financial help to start-up a little activity for himself. He is 30 years old and single, and lives with his mother still. Kindly note that in Albania most often parents live with their single or married children and grandchildren. With his mother, he lives in a large size village not far from the city of Korca.  

Marsel has been photographed in a cemetery because the type of activity he has been pursuing is carving marble tombs; his clientele has expanded the past few years; he has been called from other regions such as Elbasan and Fier to produce for them as well. 

With the financial help that he is seeking from you, Marsel wants to invest on a saw to cut marble. He wants to thank all of you in advance for the potential help.

loans.use: to buy a saw for cutting marble

loans.name: Raja

texts.en:
Raja is a 34-year-old, widowed woman from Nablus City. She is a mother for two sons. She works as an employee in a local firm where she gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family’s needs. Five years ago, Raja opened her own business, which is a farm for raising sheep. She makes diary products and sells them in the local market. 

Raja took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her farm. By taking this loan, Raja will be able to increase her productivity and also the family income.  Raja appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her farm.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 33 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. Julie requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Julie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena tiene 43 años de edad se encuentra en unión libre tiene un pequeño bebe de dos años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, hace ocho años comenzó con una pequeña pulpería.  
Inicio su negocio pensado en que era una forma de salir adelante y así obtener ingresos para mejorar su vivienda y la calidad de vida de su familia. Su esposo es su principal apoyo en suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar.
El negocio le ha permitido mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, requiere el préstamo para incrementar su inventario así comprar: Granos básicos, Gaseosas y productos varios. 
Dentro de sus planes futuros está seguir mejorando su vivienda y fortalecer su crecimiento profesional.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 43 years old, she is in a common-law marriage, she has a small baby of two years old. She has worked as a small business owner for eight years in her small grocery store.

She started her business thinking that it was a way to get ahead and thus earn income to improve her house and the quality of life of her family. Her husband is her main support in providing the basic necessities of the home.

The business has enabled her to improve the conditions of her home. She requires a loan to increase her inventory and thus buy: staple grains, soda and various products.

Her future plans include continuing to improve her house and strengthening her professional growth.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, soda and various products.

loans.name: Jonstone

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Johnstone, a 36-year-old farmer from Siongiroi, which is a small, rural town in the Rift valley of Kenya. 

This father of one is interested in many farming activities. Currently, he is doing dairy farming, tea farming, and horticulture. He has put the last four years of her life into agriculture. He loves it. His main sources of income are milk and tea. He makes extra money on the side through venturing into other personal businesses. 

He is very appreciative of the fact that farming has sustainable returns! This enables him to enjoy profits and expand. Johnstone is seeking a loan to purchase a chaff cutter, which is a mechanical device that he will use in cutting straw or hay into small pieces before being mixed together with other forage to feed his cows. 

Johnstone has been having problems feeding his cow and most of the time his cows refuse to eat but through this loan, the chaff cutter will aid the animal's digestion and prevent the cows from rejecting any part of the food. Through proper feeding, his cows will produce more milk and hence increase income through selling milk. 

Johnstone believes the key to increased milk production is proper health. A dairy cow needs roughage and protein in their diet to be healthy. A healthy cow is more productive, and that means more income for the owner. Through increased income from milk selling, he will provide a better life for his family and afford his child education.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Suglo N Bori Buni-Pishegu #1 Group

texts.en:
Fati is a hard working woman of 45 years old from Pishegu #1 in the northern part of Ghana. She is married and has five children. She is the person squatting and dressed in white with the hand holding the basin of shea nuts in their group picture. 

She belongs to a shea butter processing group. They process shea butter for both local customers and the export market. She has been doing the business over the last four years. Their group is called Suglo N bori buni-Pishegu #1 Women Association. Fati makes good profits from the business because she and every member of her group are been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality premium shea nuts and shea butter for sale.

Fati and the group have asked for a loan of GHS 8,400. Her share of the loan will help her to pay for the cost of four bags of shea nuts for processing.  By so doing, she would increase productivity and income and hence repay the loan and  support her children’s education and health needs.

loans.use: o pay for the cost of four bags of shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta de 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos todos mayores de edad y la comunión y convivencia familiar los ha caracterizado siempre. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa en el mercado desde hace unos 20 años, siempre coordina las actividades con sus hijos, ya que les ha inculcado el trabajo porque solo la han tenido a ella como padre y madre.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar faldas, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, vestidos, shorts, camisetas, etc de todo estilo. 

Lo que más desea Vicenta en la vida es seguir trabajando con mucho espíritu y seguir siendo el pilar para sus hijos para brindarles buenos consejos y verles realizados con sus respectivas parejas y anhela conocer a sus nietos y jugar con ellos.
texts.en:
Vicenta, 44, is a single mother of three children, all of whom are adults. They have always been characterized by communion and living together as a family. She has made a living buying and selling clothes in the market for about 20 years. She always coordinates her activities with her children. She taught them to work because they have only had her as both a mother and father.

She is applying for a loan to buy all styles of skirts, shirts, pants, underwear, dresses, shorts, T-shirts, etc.

What Vicenta most wants in life is to continue working with plenty of spirit and to continue being a pillar for her children, to offer them good advice and to see them grown up with their respective partners. She dreams of meeting her grandchildren and playing with them.

loans.use: to buy all styles of skirts, blouses, pants, underwear, dresses, shorts, T-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie an widowed mother is been photographed with Flamur, her 34-year-old son  who became totally blind while he was trying to assemble the gas can to the cooking stove; the accident happened about two years ago and since then he had had a massive eye surgeries here in Albania, yet at no avail. 

Marie now wants to take Flamur to Italy for another promising surgery and this is the reason why she is seeking your compassion and financial help; she has high hopes that you will lend to her; she is almost begging for help. 

Marie does agriculture and with the little money she was able to save, she has paid for her son's eye surgeries up until now.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery of her son

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA”; el banco mesta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Marleni  tiene 26 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de muebles, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de madera.
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marleni belongs to the community bank Fuente de Vida [Fountain of Life], which is located in the department of Cusco. Marleni is 25 years old, has one child and lives with her partner. She rotates her daily activities with her business of selling furniture. She has been running her business for quite some time, and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work each day.

Marleni wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family. She has requested the loan to buy wood. She is thankful for, and values the support she is given through the loan, and promises to make all of the repayments in the established installments.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 27 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Grace has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers are her potential customers. She appreciates the support of the previous loan that helped her to boost her business and earn more income.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Gezim

texts.en:
Gezim, whose name in English means Joy, is a 40-year-old villager who is requesting a loan from lenders to install roofing on his recently built family home.

“Our newly built home has no roof at all, and all this past month has been raining almost every day and it continues to pour. We have tried to cover the entire surface with plastics, yet at no avail; all the water has come inside, " said Gezim. 
 
Gezim has two teen age children, 15 and 13. He has been pursuing the agriculture/livestock activity to earn a living for his family. Currently he’s got two dairy cows and two sows, so he sells raw milk and piglets to the locals. 

In addition to livestock, he’s got about 22 dynym agricultural lands where he plants and sells mostly wheat, animal fodder, oats, and seasonal veggies.  All in all, Gezim works in construction as well and his wife has been working for nine years now in a ceramics plants. His promise is that he will pay the loan in full.

loans.use: to install roofing on the newly built family home

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Uno de los negocios característicos de Suchitepéquez es la crianza de animales de todo tipo. Desde hace 3 años Marina de 34 años, quien vive en su comunidad, se dedica a la   crianza de pollos, negocio que genera una satisfactoria ganancia para el beneficio de su familia y para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Ella tiene 3 hijos por quienes lucha cada día el primeros ya es casado y tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos son estudian en la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.

La actividad que ella realiza es la compra, venta y crianza de pollos en la comunidad donde ella vive, a ella le genera ganancias buenas porque no tiene competencia en dicho negocio y le ayuda a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.

Hace una solicitud de préstamo para la compra de pollos de granja y criollos y como también la compra de concentrado para pollos y así genera más ganancias para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y apoyar a su comunidad en un desarrollo hacia el futuro.
	
Son sus metas para generar más ingresos y el sostenimiento de su familia y seguir en la crianza de pollos y la compra de un molino de nixtamal y que sus hijos sean profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
One of the typical businesses of Suchitepéquez is raising all kinds of animals.

Marina, aged 34, lives in this community and has been making a living raising chickens for three years now. This business generates an adequate profit for the benefit of her family and the improvement of her children's living conditions. She has three children for whom she works hard every day. Her firstborn is already married and has his own family, and the other two study in the school near their community.

Marina's business consists in purchasing, selling, and raising chickens in the community where she lives. This business generates good profits because she doesn't have any competition, and it helps her improve her and her family's living conditions.

She is requesting a loan to purchase broiler and free-range chickens, and concentrated chicken feed. With this purchase, she will increase her earnings, which will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and support her community in its development for the future.

Her goals are to generate more income, support her family, continue raising chickens, purchase a "nixtamal" mill (mill to grind treated corn to make tortillas and hominy), and see that her children become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase broiler and free-range chickens, and concentrated chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an ample stock of merchandise and in this way have a ready inventory to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Carolina Jacqueline

texts.es:
La socia Carolina  continua con su negocio de taller de mantenimiento de carros la socia lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia Carolina requiere el préstamo para comprar parabrisas entre otros.
La socia Carolina pertenece al banco comunal “San Antonio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Carolina continues with her business, a shop for auto maintenance. She has been working in this business for some years, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She needs the loan to buy windshields, among other items.

Carolina belongs to the communal bank "San Antonio," which is part of the Arariwa Association of the province of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy windshields, among other items.

loans.name: Cecilia Isabel

texts.es:
Cecilia es una madre de familia dedicada, con una maravillosa familia que siempre está con ella en las buenas y en las malas. Se dedica a la fabricación de planchas de parrilla desde hace varios años y le está yendo bien en el negocio. Gracias a esto está sacando a su familia adelante y está brindado una educación de calidad a sus hijos.
Cecilia está agradecida con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le están brindado podrá comprar materiales para su negocio, así tendrá más productos en stock y sus ingresos mejorará.  Más adelante Cecilia quiere comprarse su casa propia para brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a dedicated mother of a family, with a marvelous family that is always with her in good times and in bad. She has been making grills for a number of years, and she is doing well in her business. Thanks to this, she is raising her family and is offering a quality education to her children.

Cecilia is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they are offering her, she will be able to buy materials for her business. Thus she will have more products in stock and her income will improve. In the future, Cecilia wants to buy her own house in order to offer better comfort to her family.

loans.use: to buy materials (iron and angles) to make grills

loans.name: Litiz Dunia

texts.es:
La socia Dunia continua con su negocio de  taller mecánico ,la socia lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua trabajando con su esposo en su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia Dunia requiere el préstamo para comprar parabrisas, aceité entre otros.
  La socia Dunia pertenece al banco comunal “San Antonio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
This borrower, Dunia, continues with her auto repair shop business. She has been making a living at this business for years, and thanks to the effort she puts in to her business every day, it is going well. 

She continues to work with her husband in her business and hopes to be able to continue working in order to keep supporting her family.

Dunia needs the loan to buy windshields and oil, among other things. She is a member of the San Antonio Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association in the Cusco province.

loans.use: to buy windshields and oil, among other things.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El socio Luis continua trabajando como  chef en uno de los restaurantes de la ciudad del Cusco, él socio a la vez continua con su negocio de taller mecanico,el socio lleva años dedicándose a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta ,manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio Luis requiere el préstamo para la compra de aceite entre otros. 
  El socio Luis pertenece al banco comunal “San Antonio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco
texts.en:
Luis continues working as a chef in one of the restaurants in the city of Cusco. He also continues with his repair shop. He has had this shop for years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work every day. He wants to be able to continue working so he can keep supporting his family.

Luis needs this loan to purchase oil and other supplies.

Luis belongs to the “San Antonio” Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the province of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy oil and other supplies

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 46 years old and is married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nilda has a general store business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,500 through NWTF in order to purchase more items like sardines, bread, biscuits and other groceries.

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sardines, bread, biscuits and other groceries.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She is happy for the support of the previous loan which helped her to pay fees for her kids and they were able to continue with school.

With this loan of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to harvest, clean, and store his grain, and to purchase 200 chicks, chicken feed, and to pay for repairs to his chicken house.

loans.name: Manuel Felipe

texts.es:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
El  socio Manuel  continua trabajando para una institución pública, él socio lleva años trabajando para esta institución el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le, pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio a la vez continua con su negocio de compra y  venta de repuestos para autos, el socio  es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
 El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de llantas y otros.
El  socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The loan recipient belongs to the village bank “COMUZONE II” in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco. Manuel continues his work in a public institution where he has worked for many years. It's going well for him thanks to his daily dedication to his job. He also continues with his business buying and reselling auto repair parts. He is responsible and hardworking, and this is how he is able to get his family ahead.

He asks for a loan to buy tires and other parts. He is grateful for the support given to him and promises to make his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy tires and other things.

loans.name: Luisa Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Luisa Francisca se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luisa Francisca has a grocery store where she sells basic goods like rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8am to 7pm. She's had her store for 5 years and it's going very well. Her dream is to make her grocery store bigger.

She asks for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Midred

texts.en:
Midred is a forty one year old, married, hard-working, woman with five children, living in Kamwenge Uganda. She deals in cattle fattening and selling, a business she started so as to improve her standard of living and look after her children. She also sells milk to earn additional income. 

Midred hopes to have educated children and become very rich and successful, however her main challenge is the increased price of cattle and lack of adequate capital. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle is 28 years old and is married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Richelle has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Richelle requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, eggs, sardines and school supplies.

In the future, Richelle would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, egg, sardines and school supplies.

loans.name: Stephany

texts.en:
Stephany is 34 years old and is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Stephany has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. Stephany requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, rice, noodles, cooking oil and other groceries.

In the future, Stephany would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, rice, noodles, cooking oil and other groceries.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine has owned a retail shop business. She faces a major challenge of competition from other shop operators which leads to her hardworking nature and she takes the challenge positively for her business continuity.

With the loan of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat to restock her business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat to restock her business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a 41-year-old married mother of four children from Carles, Iloilo. She has been running a fishing business with her husband for almost 23 years now. This is their main source of income.

Tessie needs a loan for their fishing business. With this, she and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Tessie hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and nets.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina se dedica al negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia vende chupetes, caramelos y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chupetes, caramelos y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ernestina sells sweets for a living, including lollipops, candies, and cookies. She works from 8am until 7pm. She has done this for 7 years now, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a grocery store.

She is requesting a loan to purchase lollipop, candies, and cookies. She is grateful for the loan and commits to repaying it on time.

loans.use: To purchase lollipops, candies, and cookies

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
El socio Carlos Enrique tiene una agencia de viajes donde  se dedica al negocio de venta de boletos turísticos a las diferentes personas del extranjero y también personas nacionales, el socio vende boletos para diferentes lugares como machupicchu y valle sagrado, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5 p.m, el socio ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener una agencia de viajes. El socio solicita le crédito para comprar boletos turísticos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carlos Enrique runs a travel agency where he sells tourist tickets to foreigners and domestic tourists. He sells tickets to various places, such as Machu Picchu and the Sacred Valley. He works from 8am to 5pm. He has had this business for 5 years, and it is going very well.

His dream is to have a travel agency. He is requesting a loan to purchase tourist tickets.

He is grateful for this loan and commits to making his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 44 years old and is married with two children, both of whom are in school. Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years. She sells a variety of items such as sardines, snack foods, noodles and other groceries. She has requested a loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

In the future Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Héctor Réne

texts.es:
Héctor  de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, sus padres por la situación económica no lo pusieron más a estudiar. Él es casado su esposa es empleada desempeñando el cargo de secretaria en una oficina, ellos tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos ya se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, el pequeño se queda en casa.

Héctor trabaja de empleado en el Juzgado de paz desde hace 14 años desempeñando el cargo de ordenanza, comenta  que es un trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos económicos. El trabajo lo obtuvo gracias a un amigo que lo recomendó, el trabajo le queda un poco cerca a un kilómetro aproximadamente de distancia de su casa, el horario de trabajo que tiene en de las 8 de la mañana a las 3 de la tarde. Antes de este trabajo tenía una pequeña tienda en su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  4 puertas de madera y las ventanas, pues su familia se siente insegura con las puestas viejas.

Héctor desea para el futuro seguir remodelando su casa y ampliarla, también para sus hijos desea lo mejor que sean personas de bien en la sociedad que sigan estudiando mucho y logren sacar una carreta universitaria.
texts.en:
Hector, who is 35 years old, studied through high school. Due to economic circumstances, his family was not able to send him for further education. He is married and his wife works as a secretary in an office. They have three children, two of whom are already at school and a little one who remains at home.

Hector has worked as an employee in the Peace Court for the last fourteen years. He works as an administrative assistant and mentions that it is a job that generates a good income. He obtained the job thanks to a friend who recommended him for it. His place of work is about a kilometer from his home. The hours he works are from 8am to 3pm. Before this job, he ran a small shop in his home.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy four wooden doors and windows since his family feels insecure with the old doors.

In the future, Hector hopes to continue remodeling his house and to enlarge it. He also hopes for the best for his children. He hopes they will be good members of society, that they will continue studying a lot and will manage to pursue a university degree.

loans.use: to buy four wooden doors and windows since his family feels insecure with the old doors.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es de la ciudad de Pilar, estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, también comenta que es madre de un niño de 8 años quien es su motivo de lucha y por quien se está esforzando para poder darle una vida sin privaciones.
Ella está esforzándose por poder salir adelante y poder crecer como persona y profesional. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, de manera a poder seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Alicia is from the city of Pilar. She is going to school and working at the same time. She also wants to mention that she is the mother of an 8-year-old, who is her motivation and whom she strives to give a life without want.

She works hard to succeed and to grow as a person and a professional. She is requesting this loan to invest in her school fees, so that she can continue striving for her goals.

loans.use: to cover school fees

loans.name: Enaam

texts.en:
Enaam is a 47-year-old single lady who has worked as book editor and writer for twenty years to cover the expenses and needs of her five family members as she is their sole earner.

Today, Enaam is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to improve her business through buying a new updated laptop which will facilitate her work, as she wants to renovate her house and make it a healthier place for her beloved family and since it is the center of her business.

She hopes to keep on developing her business and entertaining her readers with new releases.

loans.use: to buy a new updated laptop which will facilitate her work.

loans.name: Retchil

texts.en:
Retchil is 26 years old, married and has three children.  

Retchil is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She has now requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Retchil would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is 30 years old and is married.

Romelyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. Romelyn has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

In the future Romelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with seven children who all attend school and are under her care. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase a bale of kids clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Emelia

texts.en:
Ma. Emelia is a 43-year-old married mother of three children, aged 9, 7 and 3 years old. Ma. Emelia is engaged in a food vending business. She sells home cooked foods to people in her area. She also runs a small barbershop.

Ma. Emelia is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings. With this, she will be able to cook more and sell more food to the people in her area, thus increasing her income. Ma. Emelia hopes of expanding her business in the future, and of making it more sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her business, such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings.

loans.name: Gentian

texts.en:
Gentian is 29 years old and is married with a 2-year-old child. For the past five years he has been working as a carpenter in a nearby furniture plant, in the city of Lezha, while his wife has been selling hand-crafted goods that she makes herself.
 
They are renting a room in the city, but Gentian’s work is a bit far from their current residence; thus, they decided to build a small home in their village with the savings they had. They are not yet finished, as you can see from the photograph, because they ran out of cash and this is the reason why they need your financial help. Gentian’s plan is also that as soon as he starts living in the village, he will start planting because he owns 3700 square meters and will invest in dairy cows as well.

loans.use: to finish building the house and relocate; and start agriculture/livestock activity in addition to being a carpenter.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 38-year-old married woman from Matag-ob, Leyte. She has four children aged between 1 and 12 years old. 

For a year now, Marina has operated a sari-sari business to help her husband who is a farmer. In her store, she sell items like canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo and soap. Marina works hard to improve her business and her family's living situation. Marina requested this loan to buy merchandise such as noodles, eggs, canned goods, and to pay for store repairs. She hopes that this loan will help improve her business. 

Marina wishes that her business will be more successful someday.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as noodles, eggs, canned goods, and to pay for store repairs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 59 years old and is married with four children. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. She has requested a loan of PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old, married, and has eight children. Two of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Elizabeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a 19,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Elizabeth has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca has operates a business selling food. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food  business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support of the previous loans that have helped her to continue providing for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 53-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a motor vehicle spare parts business where he earns a living. He also repairs motor vehicles as a source of additional income. He used his previous loan to buy more motor vehicle spare parts to sell. He still faces the hardship of inadequate capital to meet the high demands of his customers, while his dream is to diversify his business.

Abdullah is requesting for a loan to buy more motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 35 years old and married with two children.

Nona works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She has requested a loan of PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Nona has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Nona aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo operates a motorcycle transport business from door to door. In addition, she also operates a poultry farming business which gives her another source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. 

With the loan of KES 15,000 she wants to add this to her savings and purchase another motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Aron

texts.en:
Aron is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. 

He deals in the growing and selling of coffee and bananas as his main source of income. He started the business with the intention of earning more profits and improving his standard of living. He also earns additional income from political leadership. He faces the challenges of pests and diseases that attack his crops. However, he has hopes of making more profits and becoming self sustaining.

He is requesting a loan to buy mulch and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mulch and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy equipment for his soccer school

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta operates a clothes selling business;  she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 47-year-old single mother living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

In addition to her spare parts business, she also owns a shoe business for a living. She faces a challenge of a high rates of rent but has hopes of having a wholesale business. Mary used her previous loan to buy spare parts to sell. She is requesting a new loan to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing boat and nets.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a 40-year-old hard-working married man with two children aged 15 and 12 years. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

His main business is fattening and selling cattle, along with boda boda transport and farming. He started this business to increase his income and have a better standard of living. He has hardships of theft of his cows and dry seasons that affect his cows. He has a vision of increasing the size of his farm and owning 50 acres of coffee plantation. 

Geofrey is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening and selling for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening and selling for his farm.

loans.name: Pean Group

texts.en:
Jackline is a 31-year-old married woman with two children aged 11 and 7 years old. She lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

Jackline runs a drug shop as her main source of income, and she practices gardening where she grows millet and beans as her side income. It is from these businesses that she has been able to sustain herself and look after her family. High rental and license fees are a problem, but she has hopes of expanding her business into a big pharmacy in Kamwenge Town.

She is requesting a loan to buy more tablets to sell.

loans.use: to buy more tablets to sell.

loans.name: Philipo

texts.en:
Philipo is a hard-working 40-year-old married man with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce, selling maize and coffee, along with farming where he grows bananas, cassava and coffee to earn an extra income. Philipo started this business to have a better life. He faces a challenge of weather changes that affect his produce business and price fluctuation. He has a vision of owning a big modern produce store and catering for his family needs.

Philipo is requesting a loan to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 60 years old and is married with eight children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Vergie has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for eight years. Vergie has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her cafeteria business.

In the future, Vergie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her cafeteria busines.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rukia operates a stall selling grocery vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
La Sra. Marcelina, sigue  dedicándose a la agricultura y ganaderia, La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales.
texts.en:
She belongs to the San Martin de Zurite communal bank. This bank is located in the village of Zurite, within the Anta province and the Cusco department.

Marcelina is still making a living farming and raising livestock. She is thankful for the loan granted and commits to making the payments on her debt in a disciplined fashion. She is still raising her animals in order to sell them to the clients who request them. This is the way in which she gets her family ahead. 

She requested the loan for the purchase of feed for her animals.

loans.use: for the purchase of feed for her animals

loans.name: Jocelina

texts.en:
Jocelina is 37 years old with five children ages 14-21. She manages a hog-raising business near her house. Jocelina experiences challenges due to limited funds. She can do more if she has additional capital to improve her livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy feed for her hogs and more piglets to raise. Her income will benefit her children in terms of food and education. 

She hopes to manage her business well so it will become one of her stable sources of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is a 50-year-old hardworking married man with five children aged 25, 23, 21, 17 and 5 years. He is living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the selling of cattle as his main source of income, though he also sells produce to earn extra income; he started these businesses in 2000 with the intention of earning a living and educating his children. Jamil hopes to become a model farmer, though he faces the challenges of prolonged drought.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for sale.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a hard-working divorced man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He earns a living from his bar business, which he started to look after his children. He has hardships of inadequate capital and scarcity of resources, while his dream is to diversify his business.

He intends to use the loan to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 58-year-old married man from Matag-ob, Leyte.  He has five children aged between 10 and 21. To provide for his family, he is engaged in raising pigs and growing vegetables like eggplant. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizer for his farm. 

Samson hope that this will help him have a better yield in the coming harvest season. His income will then provide a healthy diet and school fees for his children.

In the future, he hope to find a better way of earning a living while maintaining his farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 32-year-old hardworking married man with four children, aged 10, 8, 5 and 3 years, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a retail shop as his main source of income, alongside farming, where he earns extra income. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. He has personal goals of becoming a prominent businessman and being self-sustaining. His main hardship is inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand and high rate of debtors. 

He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials like cement and iron bars to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement and iron bars to complete his house.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia Edith  se dedica al negocio de guía de turismo,  la socia por medio de este trabajo y de este negocio quieren salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio de hospedaje. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Edith makes a living in the tour guide business. She wants to get ahead through this work and through this business. 

Her dream is to have a hotel business. She is requesting the loan in order to buy a television for her house. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy a television for her home

loans.name: Khalifa Malick Sy

texts.fr:
Khalifa Malick Sy est un jeune tailleur qui a une expérience de plus de 3 ans dans ce domaine d’activité. Il s’active aussi dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires et de l’élevage de poulets de chair. Il a déjà bénéficié de trois crédit à l’IMCEC et renouvelle afin d’acheter des poussins et élever à l’occasion des fêtes de la « Tamxarit (fête religieuse musulmane pendant laquelle le repas est fait à base de couscous et de poulet). Avec le prêt, il va acheter 100 poussins et leur alimentation.
Khalifa Malick Sy travaille aussi dans une usine de poisson depuis un an, voulant toujours diversifier et maximiser ses revenus.
Il est célibataire et vit avec ses parents et ses frères. Il n’a pas de charges familiales sinon une participation bimestrielle pour le payement des frais d’électricité.
Son ambition serait de clôturer sa parcelle pour en faire un poulailler et augmenter le nombre de poussins à élever.
texts.en:
Khalifa Malick Sy is a young tailor who has over 3 years' experience in this field. He is also active in trading food products and rearing broilers.

He has already been granted three loans from IMCEC and is requesting another one to buy chicks to raise for the celebrations surrounding "Tamxarit" (a Muslim religious festival during which the meal is prepared with couscous and chicken). He will use the loan to buy 100 chicks and their feed. 

Khalifa Malick Sy has also been working in a fish factory for a year, always wanting to diversify and maximize his income. 

He is single and lives with his parents and brothers. He has no family responsibilities apart from a bimonthly participation in electricity costs.

His ambition is to enclose his land-plot and make it into a chicken coop, so he can increase the number of chicks to raise.

loans.use: buy chicks to rear and resell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, she lives at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over three years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura es un agricultor de 74 años de edad,  su nivel académico llega hasta quinto grado de educación básica.  Está casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya están casados y uno de ellos vive junto a él.

Buenaventura tiene 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, esta actividad fue enseñada por su padre quien también era un agricultor, actualmente él se dedica a trabajar tres hectáreas de maíz y dos hectáreas de jícama estas tierras que cultiva están a una distancia de dos kilómetros desde donde él vive.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos tales como abonos y fertilizantes, ya que el cultivo esta temporada se ha metido de lleno al trabajo agrícola y con el dinero del préstamo podrá aplicarle la segunda abonada al cultivo de maíz, ya que está próximo a rendir sus frutos.

El sueño que tiene es obtener un excelente cultivo que sea próspero y abundante para poder vender una buena cosecha que le genere buenas ganancias y sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su  crédito.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is a 74-year-old farmer. He reached an academic level of fifth grade in primary school. He is married and has two children who are already married, and one of them lives with him.

Buenaventura has been working in agriculture for 30 years. This work was taught to him by his father who was also a farmer. He currently works three hectares of corn and two hectares of jicama. The land that he cultivates is two kilometers from where he lives.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies such as compost and fertilizer. Since this season he has been 100% dedicated to his farming work, he can apply the money from the loan to the second fertilization of the corn crops, since they are about to bear fruit.

His dream is to obtain an excellent harvest that is successful and abundant so that he can sell a good harvest that will generate good earnings for him, and he knows that he can achieve this with the help of his loan.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer to apply a second fertilization to the corn crops

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 31-year-old single man who has specialized in fixing and painting car body work for eight years. He is the sole earner of his family that consists of eight, which puts so much pressure on him to develop his business to make sure that he is capable of replying to their needs.
Today, George is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to make necessary constructions for his house, to keep it a healthy living place for his beloved family. George works hard to provide his family not only with a good financial situation but also with better living conditions.

loans.use: To make necessary constructions for his house, to keep it a healthy living place for his beloved family.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 66 years old from Leyte. He is married with two children aged 11 and 12. Manuel has been a farmer since he was a young boy. He plants vegetables and rice. He is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP to buy fertilizer, a sprayer and seeds that are necessary for his crops. Manuel hopes that the loan will impact on his farming, particularly on his crop yield. 

His income will provide his family's basic needs of food and household expense. Other income will also be reinvested in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a sprayer and seeds

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:
Mariza is a resident from the typhoon-affected town of Carles, Iloilo. She is a married woman and has three children. Marisa and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than 20 years now. Fishing is their main source of income.
Mariza is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of their fishing boat. Mariza dreams of expanding their fishing business and making it a success. She also wants to save money so that she can continue in supporting her children's education.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Flambeau De Petitanse 1, 2 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Monise est la coordinatrice de son groupe Flambeau de Petitanse. Elle est marie et elle a 3 enfant. Elle habite dans la region nord d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l'éau portable est très limité.

Monise dirige son commerce de produit divers pendant les 4 derniers années. Elle va a acheter des cosmetiques, chaussures, vetement, etc. Avant de commerce, Elle était commercant. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres de Flambeau de Petitanse ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produit cosmétiques, poisson, boissons gazeuses, produit alimentaires, etc. Elle dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera a voyager dans les autres pays de l’amerique.
texts.en:
Monise is the coordinator of the Flambeau de Petitanse group. She is married with three children, and lives in the northern region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and drinking water is very limited. 

Monise has been running a grocery store for the past four years. She will buy cosmetics, shoes, clothing, etc. Before running the store, she was a trader. She hopes that this loan will help her expand her business. 

Other members of the Flambeau de Petitanse group need a loan to trade cosmetics, fish, soft drinks, food products, etc.

She says her main goal is to have a bigger store which will facilitate travelling to other countries in the Americas.

loans.use: buy cosmetics, shoes, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida, 44 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a shopkeeping business for many years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Abida needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

Abida has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items, including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a resident of Matag-ob, Leyte. She is married with two children, ages 3 and 8. For the last five years, Pacita has been engaged in a hog-raising business. It is quite a challenge for someone like her to be in this business because she has to wait for four months before she can sell her pigs. She is asking for a loan in order to keep her hogs healthy. She will use the loan to buy feed. 

Her income will be for her children's school fees and family consumption. She hope that someday, she can have other means for a better and abundant living for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.  She, along with her husband, has been doing the work of agriculture for many years. She crops different vegetables and fruits and then sells them in the local market. Her husband also assists her in growing the various crops by watering the soil for good quality production. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Abida applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en:
Suraya is a hardworking, married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting stitching clothes at her home. Suraya is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. 

Therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). She is in her seventh loan cycle. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth. She hopes that her stitching business will be very successful and will generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth.
